31 //
32 // The maximum number of image object (object table entries) is
33 // the number which will fit into the MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER with
34 // the start of the PE image header in the last word of the first.
35 //

38  ((MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER - (PAGE_SIZE + sizeof(IMAGE_NT_HEADERS))) / \
39  sizeof(IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER))

131 NTSTATUS
132 NtCreateSection (
133  __out PHANDLE SectionHandle,
134  __in ACCESS_MASK DesiredAccess,
135  __in_opt POBJECT_ATTRIBUTES ObjectAttributes,
136  __in_opt PLARGE_INTEGER MaximumSize,
137  __in ULONG SectionPageProtection,
138  __in ULONG AllocationAttributes,
139  __in_opt HANDLE FileHandle
140  )
141 
142 /*++
143 
144 Routine Description:
145 
146  This function creates a section object and opens a handle to the object
147  with the specified desired access.
148 
149 Arguments:
150 
151  SectionHandle - A pointer to a variable that will
152  receive the section object handle value.
153 
154  DesiredAccess - The desired types of access for the section.
155 
156  DesiredAccess Flags
157 
158  EXECUTE - Execute access to the section is desired.
159 
160  READ - Read access to the section is desired.
161 
162  WRITE - Write access to the section is desired.
163 
164  ObjectAttributes - Supplies a pointer to an object attributes structure.
165 
166  MaximumSize - Supplies the maximum size of the section in bytes.
167  This value is rounded up to the host page size and
168  specifies the size of the section (page file
169  backed section) or the maximum size to which a
170  file can be extended or mapped (file backed
171  section).
172 
173  SectionPageProtection - Supplies the protection to place on each page
174  in the section. One of PAGE_READ, PAGE_READWRITE,
175  PAGE_EXECUTE, or PAGE_WRITECOPY and, optionally,
176  PAGE_NOCACHE or PAGE_WRITECOMBINE
177  may be specified.
178 
179  AllocationAttributes - Supplies a set of flags that describe the
180  allocation attributes of the section.
181 
182  AllocationAttributes Flags
183 
184  SEC_BASED - The section is a based section and will be
185  allocated at the same virtual address in each process
186  address space that receives the section. This does not
187  imply that addresses are reserved for based sections.
188  Rather if the section cannot be mapped at the based address
189  an error is returned.
190 
191 
192  SEC_RESERVE - All pages of the section are set to the reserved state.
193 
194  SEC_COMMIT - All pages of the section are set to the commit state.
195 
196  SEC_IMAGE - The file specified by the file handle is an
197  executable image file.
198 
199  SEC_FILE - The file specified by the file handle is a mapped
200  file. If a file handle is supplied and neither
201  SEC_IMAGE or SEC_FILE is supplied, SEC_FILE is
202  assumed.
203 
204  SEC_NO_CHANGE - Once the file is mapped, the protection cannot
205  be changed nor can the view be unmapped. The
206  view is unmapped when the process is deleted.
207  Cannot be used with SEC_IMAGE.
208 
209  SEC_LARGE_PAGES - The section will be created using large pages.
210  This physical memory is allocated immediately upon
211  section creation (instead of upon access). If
212  contiguous physical memory for the large page(s)
213  cannot be found, then the section creation will fail
214  (rather than use small pages).
215 
216  Since this physical memory is allocated up front and
217  is nonpaged (to ensure it remains physically
218  contiguous and in a large page), privilege is
219  required. Since section mappers can extend the
220  section life indefinitely, section creators should
221  ensure proper access permissions are used.
222 
223  Note subsequent mapped views must specify a large
224  page aligned start address and length (or must
225  have available virtual space so the system can find
226  one) for them to automatically receive large page(s)
227  for the view. Callers of the map APIs do not need
228  to specify large pages - the system will automatically
229  provide the mapping in large pages (assuming
230  satisfactory alignment) or small pages if not.
231 
232  FileHandle - Supplies an optional handle of an open file object.
233  If the value of this handle is NULL, then the
234  section will be backed by a paging file. Otherwise
235  the section is backed by the specified data file.
236 
237 Return Value:
238 
239  NTSTATUS.
240 
241 --*/
242 
243 {
244  NTSTATUS Status;
245  PVOID Section;
246  HANDLE Handle;
247  LARGE_INTEGER LargeSize;
248  LARGE_INTEGER CapturedSize;
249  ULONG RetryCount;
250  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
251 
252  if ((AllocationAttributes & ~(SEC_COMMIT | SEC_RESERVE | SEC_BASED |
253  SEC_LARGE_PAGES | SEC_IMAGE | SEC_NOCACHE |
254  SEC_NO_CHANGE)) != 0) {
255  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_6;
256  }
257 
258  if ((AllocationAttributes & (SEC_COMMIT | SEC_RESERVE | SEC_IMAGE)) == 0) {
259  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_6;
260  }
261 
262  if ((AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) &&
263  (AllocationAttributes & (SEC_COMMIT | SEC_RESERVE |
264  SEC_LARGE_PAGES |
265  SEC_NOCACHE | SEC_NO_CHANGE))) {
266 
267  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_6;
268  }
269 
270  if ((AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) &&
271  (AllocationAttributes & SEC_RESERVE)) {
272  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_6;
273  }
274 
275  //
276  // Check the SectionProtection Flag.
277  //
278 
279  if ((SectionPageProtection & PAGE_NOCACHE) ||
280  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_WRITECOMBINE) ||
281  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_GUARD) ||
282  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_NOACCESS)) {
283 
284  //
285  // No cache is only specified through the SEC_NOCACHE
286  // option in the allocation attributes.
287  //
288 
289  return STATUS_INVALID_PAGE_PROTECTION;
290  }
291 
292 
293  if (KeGetPreviousMode() != KernelMode) {
294  try {
295  ProbeForWriteHandle(SectionHandle);
296 
297  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT (MaximumSize)) {
298 
299 #if !defined (_WIN64)
300 
301  //
302  // Note we only probe for byte alignment because prior to 2195,
303  // we never probed at all! We don't want to break user apps
304  // that had bad alignment if they worked before.
305  //
306 
307  ProbeForReadSmallStructure(MaximumSize, sizeof(LARGE_INTEGER), sizeof(UCHAR));
308 #else
309  ProbeForReadSmallStructure(MaximumSize, sizeof(LARGE_INTEGER), PROBE_ALIGNMENT (LARGE_INTEGER));
310 #endif
311  LargeSize = *MaximumSize;
312  }
313  else {
314  ZERO_LARGE (LargeSize);
315  }
316 
317  } except (EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER) {
318  return GetExceptionCode();
319  }
320  }
321  else {
322  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT (MaximumSize)) {
323  LargeSize = *MaximumSize;
324  }
325  else {
326  ZERO_LARGE (LargeSize);
327  }
328  }
329 
330  RetryCount = 0;
331 
332 retry:
333 
334  CapturedSize = LargeSize;
335 
336  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql() < DISPATCH_LEVEL);
337  Status = MmCreateSection (&Section,
338  DesiredAccess,
339  ObjectAttributes,
340  &CapturedSize,
341  SectionPageProtection,
342  AllocationAttributes,
343  FileHandle,
344  NULL);
345 
346 
347  ASSERT (KeGetCurrentIrql() < DISPATCH_LEVEL);
348  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
349  if ((Status == STATUS_FILE_LOCK_CONFLICT) &&
350  (RetryCount < 3)) {
351 
352  //
353  // The file system may have prevented this from working
354  // due to log file flushing. Delay and try again.
355  //
356 
357  RetryCount += 1;
358 
359  KeDelayExecutionThread (KernelMode,
360  FALSE,
361  (PLARGE_INTEGER)&MmHalfSecond);
362 
363  goto retry;
364 
365  }
366  return Status;
367  }
368 
369  ControlArea = ((PSECTION)Section)->Segment->ControlArea;
370 
371  if ((ControlArea != NULL) && (ControlArea->FilePointer != NULL)) {
372  CcZeroEndOfLastPage (ControlArea->FilePointer);
373  }
374 
375  //
376  // Note if the insertion fails, Ob will dereference the object for us.
377  //
378 
379  Status = ObInsertObject (Section,
380  NULL,
381  DesiredAccess,
382  0,
383  (PVOID *)NULL,
384  &Handle);
385 
386  if (NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
387  try {
388  *SectionHandle = Handle;
389  } except (EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER) {
390 
391  //
392  // If the write attempt fails, then do not report an error.
393  // When the caller attempts to access the handle value,
394  // an access violation will occur.
395  //
396  }
397  }
398 
399  return Status;
400 }
401 
402 NTSTATUS
403 MmCreateSection (
404  __deref_out PVOID *SectionObject,
405  __in ACCESS_MASK DesiredAccess,
406  __in_opt POBJECT_ATTRIBUTES ObjectAttributes,
407  __in PLARGE_INTEGER InputMaximumSize,
408  __in WIN32_PROTECTION_MASK SectionPageProtection,
409  __in ULONG AllocationAttributes,
410  __in_opt HANDLE FileHandle,
411  __in_opt PFILE_OBJECT FileObject
412  )
413 
414 /*++
415 
416 Routine Description:
417 
418  This function creates a section object and opens a handle to the object
419  with the specified desired access.
420 
421 Arguments:
422 
423  Section - A pointer to a variable that will
424  receive the section object address.
425 
426  DesiredAccess - The desired types of access for the section.
427 
428  DesiredAccess Flags
429 
430  EXECUTE - Execute access to the section is desired.
431 
432  READ - Read access to the section is desired.
433 
434  WRITE - Write access to the section is desired.
435 
436  ObjectAttributes - Supplies a pointer to an object attributes structure.
437 
438  InputMaximumSize - Supplies the maximum size of the section in bytes.
439  This value is rounded up to the host page size and
440  specifies the size of the section (page file
441  backed section) or the maximum size to which a
442  file can be extended or mapped (file backed
443  section).
444 
445  SectionPageProtection - Supplies the protection to place on each page
446  in the section. One of PAGE_READ, PAGE_READWRITE,
447  PAGE_EXECUTE, or PAGE_WRITECOPY and, optionally,
448  PAGE_NOCACHE or PAGE_WRITECOMBINE may be specified.
449 
450  Note the NO_CACHE, write combined and GUARD
451  attributes are mutually exclusive.
452  MiMakeProtectionMask enforces this.
453 
454  AllocationAttributes - Supplies a set of flags that describe the
455  allocation attributes of the section.
456 
457  AllocationAttributes Flags
458 
459  SEC_BASED - The section is a based section and will be
460  allocated at the same virtual address in each process
461  address space that receives the section. This does not
462  imply that addresses are reserved for based sections.
463  Rather if the section cannot be mapped at the based address
464  an error is returned.
465 
466  SEC_RESERVE - All pages of the section are set to the
467  reserved state.
468 
469  SEC_COMMIT - All pages of the section are set to the commit state.
470 
471  SEC_IMAGE - The file specified by the file handle is an
472  executable image file.
473 
474  SEC_FILE - The file specified by the file handle is a mapped
475  file. If a file handle is supplied and neither
476  SEC_IMAGE or SEC_FILE is supplied, SEC_FILE is
477  assumed.
478 
479  SEC_LARGE_PAGES - The section will be created using large pages.
480  This physical memory is allocated immediately upon
481  section creation (instead of upon access). If
482  contiguous physical memory for the large page(s)
483  cannot be found, then the section creation will fail
484  (rather than use small pages).
485 
486  Since this physical memory is allocated up front and
487  is nonpaged (to ensure it remains physically
488  contiguous and in a large page), privilege is
489  required. Since section mappers can extend the
490  section life indefinitely, section creators should
491  ensure proper access permissions are used.
492 
493  Note subsequent mapped views must specify a large
494  page aligned start address and length (or must
495  have available virtual space so the system can find
496  one) for them to automatically receive large page(s)
497  for the view. Callers of the map APIs do not need
498  to specify large pages - the system will automatically
499  provide the mapping in large pages (assuming
500  satisfactory alignment) or small pages if not.
501 
502  FileHandle - Supplies an optional handle of an open file object.
503  If the value of this handle is null, then the
504  section will be backed by a paging file. Otherwise
505  the section is backed by the specified data file.
506 
507  FileObject - Supplies an optional pointer to the file object. If this
508  value is NULL and the FileHandle is NULL, then there is
509  no file to map (image or mapped file). If this value
510  is specified, then the File is to be mapped as a MAPPED FILE
511  and NO file size checking will be performed.
512 
513  ONLY THE SYSTEM CACHE SHOULD PROVIDE A FILE OBJECT WITH THE
514  CALL!! as this is optimized to not check the size, only do
515  data mapping, no protection check, etc.
516 
517  Note - Only one of FileHandle or File should be specified!
518 
519 Return Value:
520 
521  Returns the relevant NTSTATUS code.
522 
523 --*/
524 
525 {
526  SECTION Section;
527  PSECTION NewSection;
528  PSUBSECTION Subsection;
529  ULONG SubsectionSize;
530  PSEGMENT Segment;
531  PSEGMENT NewSegment;
532  KPROCESSOR_MODE PreviousMode;
533  KIRQL OldIrql;
534  NTSTATUS Status;
535  NTSTATUS Status2;
536  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
537  PCONTROL_AREA NewControlArea;
538  PCONTROL_AREA SegmentControlArea;
539  ACCESS_MASK FileDesiredAccess;
540  PFILE_OBJECT File;
541  PEVENT_COUNTER Event;
542  ULONG IgnoreFileSizing;
543  ULONG ProtectionMask;
544  ULONG ProtectMaskForAccess;
545  ULONG FileAcquired;
546  PEVENT_COUNTER SegmentEvent;
547  LOGICAL FileSizeChecked;
548  LARGE_INTEGER TempSectionSize;
549  UINT64 EndOfFile;
550  ULONG IncrementedRefCount;
551  SIZE_T ControlAreaSize;
552  PUINT64 MaximumSize;
553  PMM_AVL_TABLE SectionBasedRoot;
554  LOGICAL GlobalNeeded;
555  PFILE_OBJECT ChangeFileReference;
556  SIZE_T SizeOfSection;
557  ULONG PagedPoolCharge;
558  ULONG NonPagedPoolCharge;
559 #if DBG
560  PVOID PreviousSectionPointer;
561 
562  PreviousSectionPointer = (PVOID)-1;
563 #endif
564 
565  NewControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA)-1;
566 
567  UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER (DesiredAccess);
568 
569  IgnoreFileSizing = FALSE;
570  FileAcquired = FALSE;
571  FileSizeChecked = FALSE;
572  IncrementedRefCount = FALSE;
573 
574  MaximumSize = (PUINT64) InputMaximumSize;
575 
576  //
577  // Check allocation attributes flags.
578  //
579 
580  File = NULL;
581 
582  ASSERT ((AllocationAttributes & ~(SEC_COMMIT | SEC_RESERVE | SEC_BASED |
583  SEC_LARGE_PAGES | SEC_IMAGE | SEC_NOCACHE | SEC_NO_CHANGE)) == 0);
584 
585  ASSERT ((AllocationAttributes & (SEC_COMMIT | SEC_RESERVE | SEC_IMAGE)) != 0);
586 
587  ASSERT (!((AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) &&
588  (AllocationAttributes & (SEC_COMMIT | SEC_RESERVE |
589  SEC_NOCACHE | SEC_NO_CHANGE))));
590 
591  ASSERT (!((AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) &&
592  (AllocationAttributes & SEC_RESERVE)));
593 
594  ASSERT (!((SectionPageProtection & PAGE_NOCACHE) ||
595  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_WRITECOMBINE) ||
596  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_GUARD) ||
597  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_NOACCESS)));
598 
599  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_NOCACHE) {
600  SectionPageProtection |= PAGE_NOCACHE;
601  }
602 
603  //
604  // Check the protection field.
605  //
606 
607  ProtectionMask = MiMakeProtectionMask (SectionPageProtection);
608  if (ProtectionMask == MM_INVALID_PROTECTION) {
609  return STATUS_INVALID_PAGE_PROTECTION;
610  }
611 
612  ProtectMaskForAccess = ProtectionMask & 0x7;
613 
614  FileDesiredAccess = MmMakeFileAccess[ProtectMaskForAccess];
615 
616  //
617  // Get previous processor mode and probe output arguments if necessary.
618  //
619 
620  PreviousMode = KeGetPreviousMode ();
621 
622  Section.InitialPageProtection = SectionPageProtection;
623  Section.Segment = NULL;
624 
625  //
626  // Initializing Segment is not needed for correctness, but
627  // without it the compiler cannot compile this code W4 to check
628  // for use of uninitialized variables.
629  //
630 
631  Segment = (PSEGMENT)-1;
632 
633  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT(FileHandle) || ARGUMENT_PRESENT(FileObject)) {
634 
635  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_LARGE_PAGES) {
636  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_6;
637  }
638 
639  //
640  // Only one of FileHandle or FileObject should be supplied.
641  // If a FileObject is supplied, this must be from the
642  // file system and therefore the file's size should not
643  // be checked.
644  //
645 
646  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT(FileObject)) {
647  IgnoreFileSizing = TRUE;
648  File = FileObject;
649 
650  //
651  // Quick check to see if a control area already exists.
652  //
653 
654  if (File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject) {
655 
656  ChangeFileReference = NULL;
657 
658  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
659  ControlArea =
660  (PCONTROL_AREA)(File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject);
661 
662  if ((ControlArea != NULL) &&
663  (!ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingDeleted) &&
664  (!ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated)) {
665 
666  //
667  // Control area exists and is not being deleted,
668  // reference it.
669  //
670 
671  NewSegment = ControlArea->Segment;
672  if ((ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences == 0) &&
673  (ControlArea->NumberOfMappedViews == 0) &&
674  (ControlArea->ModifiedWriteCount == 0)) {
675 
676  //
677  // Dereference the current file object (after releasing
678  // the PFN lock) and reference this one.
679  //
680 
681  ASSERT (ControlArea->FilePointer != NULL);
682  ChangeFileReference = ControlArea->FilePointer;
683  ControlArea->FilePointer = FileObject;
684  }
685  ControlArea->u.Flags.Accessed = 1;
686  ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences += 1;
687  if (ControlArea->DereferenceList.Flink != NULL) {
688 
689  //
690  // Remove this from the list of unused segments.
691  //
692 
693  RemoveEntryList (&ControlArea->DereferenceList);
694 
695  MI_UNUSED_SEGMENTS_REMOVE_CHARGE (ControlArea);
696 
697  ControlArea->DereferenceList.Flink = NULL;
698  ControlArea->DereferenceList.Blink = NULL;
699  }
700  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
701 
702  //
703  // Inform the object manager to defer this deletion by
704  // queueing it to another thread to eliminate deadlocks
705  // with the redirector.
706  //
707 
708  if (ChangeFileReference != NULL) {
709  ObDereferenceObjectDeferDelete (ChangeFileReference);
710  ObReferenceObject (FileObject);
711  }
712 
713  IncrementedRefCount = TRUE;
714  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)*MaximumSize;
715 
716  goto ReferenceObject;
717  }
718  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
719  }
720 
721  ObReferenceObject (FileObject);
722 
723  }
724  else {
725 
726  Status = ObReferenceObjectByHandle (FileHandle,
727  FileDesiredAccess,
728  IoFileObjectType,
729  PreviousMode,
730  (PVOID *)&File,
731  NULL);
732  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
733  return Status;
734  }
735 
736  //
737  // If this file doesn't have a section object pointer,
738  // return an error.
739  //
740 
741  if (File->SectionObjectPointer == NULL) {
742  ObDereferenceObject (File);
743  return STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
744  }
745  }
746 
747  //
748  // Check to see if the specified file already has a section.
749  // If not, indicate in the file object's pointer to an FCB that
750  // a section is being built. This synchronizes segment creation
751  // for the file.
752  //
753 
754  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
755 
756  //
757  // This control area is always just a place holder - the real one
758  // is allocated in MiCreateImageFileMap and will be allocated
759  // with the correct size and this one freed in a short while.
760  //
761  // This place holder must always be allocated as a large control
762  // area so that it can be chained for the per-session case.
763  //
764 
765  ControlAreaSize = sizeof(LARGE_CONTROL_AREA) + sizeof(SUBSECTION);
766 
767  //
768  // For image sections, make sure that Cc has released all references
769  // to the section due to a previous data section mapping. This will
770  // decrease the chance that the image will need to be backed by
771  // the pagefile because writeable data sections remain on the file.
772  //
773 
774  CcWaitForUninitializeCacheMap (File);
775  }
776  else {
777 
778  //
779  // Data files are mapped with larger subsections than images or
780  // pagefile-backed shared memory. Factor that in here.
781  //
782 
783  ControlAreaSize = sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) + sizeof(MSUBSECTION);
784  }
785 
786  NewControlArea = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
787  ControlAreaSize,
788  MMCONTROL);
789 
790  if (NewControlArea == NULL) {
791  ObDereferenceObject (File);
792  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
793  }
794 
795  RtlZeroMemory (NewControlArea, ControlAreaSize);
796 
797  NewSegment = NULL;
798 
799  //
800  // We only need the file resource if this was a user request, i.e. not
801  // a call from the cache manager or file system.
802  //
803 
804  if (ARGUMENT_PRESENT (FileHandle)) {
805 
806  PIRP tempIrp = (PIRP)FSRTL_FSP_TOP_LEVEL_IRP;
807 
808  Status = FsRtlAcquireToCreateMappedSection (File, SectionPageProtection);
809 
810  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
811  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
812  ObDereferenceObject (File);
813  return Status;
814  }
815 
816  IoSetTopLevelIrp (tempIrp);
817  FileAcquired = TRUE;
818  }
819 
820  //
821  // Initializing GlobalNeeded is not needed for correctness, but
822  // without it the compiler cannot compile this code W4 to check
823  // for use of uninitialized variables.
824  //
825 
826  GlobalNeeded = FALSE;
827  SegmentEvent = NULL;
828 
829 RecheckSegment:
830 
831  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
832 
833  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
834 
835  ControlArea = MiFindImageSectionObject (File, TRUE, &GlobalNeeded);
836 
837  }
838  else {
839  ControlArea =
840  (PCONTROL_AREA)(File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject);
841  }
842 
843  if (ControlArea != NULL) {
844 
845  //
846  // A segment already exists for this file. Make sure that it
847  // is not in the process of being deleted, or being created.
848  //
849 
850  if ((ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingDeleted) ||
851  (ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated)) {
852 
853  //
854  // The segment object is in the process of being deleted or
855  // created.
856  // Check to see if another thread is waiting for the deletion,
857  // otherwise create an event object to wait upon.
858  //
859 
860  if (ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion == NULL) {
861 
862  //
863  // Initialize an event and put its address
864  // in the control area.
865  //
866 
867  if (SegmentEvent == NULL) {
868 
869  //
870  // Allocate an event to wait as the segment
871  // is in the process of being deleted. This event
872  // cannot be allocated with the PFN database locked
873  // as pool expansion would deadlock.
874  //
875 
876  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
877 
878  SegmentEvent = MiGetEventCounter ();
879 
880  if (SegmentEvent == NULL) {
881  if (FileAcquired) {
882  IoSetTopLevelIrp (NULL);
883  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
884  }
885  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
886  ObDereferenceObject (File);
887  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
888  }
889 
890  goto RecheckSegment;
891  }
892 
893  ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion = SegmentEvent;
894  Event = SegmentEvent;
895  SegmentEvent = NULL;
896  }
897  else {
898  Event = ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion;
899 
900  //
901  // No interlock is needed for the RefCount increment as
902  // no thread can be decrementing it since it is still
903  // pointed to by the control area.
904  //
905 
906  Event->RefCount += 1;
907  }
908 
909  //
910  // Release the PFN lock, the file lock, and wait for the event.
911  //
912 
913  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
914  if (FileAcquired) {
915  IoSetTopLevelIrp (NULL);
916  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
917  }
918 
919  KeWaitForSingleObject (&Event->Event,
920  WrVirtualMemory,
921  KernelMode,
922  FALSE,
923  (PLARGE_INTEGER)NULL);
924 
925  //
926  // Before this event can be set, the control area
927  // WaitingForDeletion field must be cleared (and may be
928  // reinitialized to something else), but cannot be reset
929  // to our local event. This allows us to dereference the
930  // event count lock free.
931  //
932 
933  MiFreeEventCounter (Event);
934 
935  if (FileAcquired) {
936  Status = FsRtlAcquireToCreateMappedSection (File, SectionPageProtection);
937 
938  if (NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
939  PIRP tempIrp = (PIRP)FSRTL_FSP_TOP_LEVEL_IRP;
940  IoSetTopLevelIrp (tempIrp);
941  }
942  else {
943  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
944  ObDereferenceObject (File);
945  return Status;
946  }
947  }
948 
949  goto RecheckSegment;
950  }
951 
952  //
953  // There is already a segment for this file, have
954  // this section refer to that segment.
955  // No need to reference the file object any more.
956  //
957 
958  if ((ControlArea->u.Flags.ImageMappedInSystemSpace) &&
959  (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) &&
960  (KeGetPreviousMode () != KernelMode)) {
961 
962  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
963 
964  if (SegmentEvent != NULL) {
965  MiFreeEventCounter (SegmentEvent);
966  }
967  if (FileAcquired) {
968  IoSetTopLevelIrp (NULL);
969  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
970  }
971  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
972  ObDereferenceObject (File);
973  return STATUS_CONFLICTING_ADDRESSES;
974  }
975 
976  NewSegment = ControlArea->Segment;
977  ControlArea->u.Flags.Accessed = 1;
978  ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences += 1;
979  if (ControlArea->DereferenceList.Flink != NULL) {
980 
981  //
982  // Remove this from the list of unused segments.
983  //
984 
985  RemoveEntryList (&ControlArea->DereferenceList);
986 
987  MI_UNUSED_SEGMENTS_REMOVE_CHARGE (ControlArea);
988 
989  ControlArea->DereferenceList.Flink = NULL;
990  ControlArea->DereferenceList.Blink = NULL;
991  }
992  IncrementedRefCount = TRUE;
993 
994  //
995  // If this reference was not from the cache manager
996  // up the count of user references.
997  //
998 
999  if (IgnoreFileSizing == FALSE) {
1000  ControlArea->NumberOfUserReferences += 1;
1001  }
1002  }
1003  else {
1004 
1005  //
1006  // There is no segment associated with this file object.
1007  // Set the file object to refer to the new control area.
1008  //
1009 
1010  ControlArea = NewControlArea;
1011  ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated = 1;
1012 
1013  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
1014  if (GlobalNeeded == TRUE) {
1015  ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession = 1;
1016  }
1017 
1018  MiInsertImageSectionObject (File, ControlArea);
1019  }
1020  else {
1021 #if DBG
1022  PreviousSectionPointer = File->SectionObjectPointer;
1023 #endif
1024  File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject = (PVOID) ControlArea;
1025  }
1026  }
1027 
1028  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1029 
1030  if (SegmentEvent != NULL) {
1031  MiFreeEventCounter (SegmentEvent);
1032  }
1033 
1034  if (NewSegment != NULL) {
1035 
1036  //
1037  // A segment already exists for this file object.
1038  // If we're creating an imagemap, flush the data section
1039  // if there is one.
1040  //
1041 
1042  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
1043  MiFlushDataSection (File);
1044  }
1045 
1046  //
1047  // Deallocate the new control area as it won't be needed.
1048  // Dereference the file object later when we're done with it.
1049  //
1050 
1051  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
1052 
1053  //
1054  // The section is in paged pool, this can't be set until
1055  // the PFN mutex has been released.
1056  //
1057 
1058  if ((!IgnoreFileSizing) && (ControlArea->u.Flags.Image == 0)) {
1059 
1060  //
1061  // The file size in the segment may not match the current
1062  // file size, query the file system and get the file
1063  // size.
1064  //
1065 
1066  Status = FsRtlGetFileSize (File, (PLARGE_INTEGER)&EndOfFile);
1067 
1068  if (!NT_SUCCESS (Status)) {
1069 
1070  if (FileAcquired) {
1071  IoSetTopLevelIrp(NULL);
1072  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
1073  FileAcquired = FALSE;
1074  }
1075 
1076  ObDereferenceObject (File);
1077  goto UnrefAndReturn;
1078  }
1079 
1080  if (EndOfFile == 0 && *MaximumSize == 0) {
1081 
1082  //
1083  // Can't map a zero length without specifying the maximum
1084  // size as non-zero.
1085  //
1086 
1087  Status = STATUS_MAPPED_FILE_SIZE_ZERO;
1088 
1089  if (FileAcquired) {
1090  IoSetTopLevelIrp(NULL);
1091  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
1092  FileAcquired = FALSE;
1093  }
1094 
1095  ObDereferenceObject (File);
1096  goto UnrefAndReturn;
1097  }
1098  }
1099  else {
1100 
1101  //
1102  // The size is okay in the segment.
1103  //
1104 
1105  EndOfFile = (UINT64) NewSegment->SizeOfSegment;
1106  }
1107 
1108  if (FileAcquired) {
1109  IoSetTopLevelIrp(NULL);
1110  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
1111  FileAcquired = FALSE;
1112  }
1113 
1114  ObDereferenceObject (File);
1115 
1116  if (*MaximumSize == 0) {
1117 
1118  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)EndOfFile;
1119  FileSizeChecked = TRUE;
1120  }
1121  else if (EndOfFile >= *MaximumSize) {
1122 
1123  //
1124  // EndOfFile is greater than the MaximumSize,
1125  // use the specified maximum size.
1126  //
1127 
1128  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)*MaximumSize;
1129  FileSizeChecked = TRUE;
1130  }
1131  else {
1132 
1133  //
1134  // Need to extend the section, make sure the file was
1135  // opened for write access.
1136  //
1137 
1138  if (((SectionPageProtection & PAGE_READWRITE) |
1139  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE)) == 0) {
1140 
1141  Status = STATUS_SECTION_TOO_BIG;
1142  goto UnrefAndReturn;
1143  }
1144  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)*MaximumSize;
1145  }
1146  }
1147  else {
1148 
1149  //
1150  // The file does not have an associated segment, create a segment
1151  // object.
1152  //
1153 
1154  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
1155 
1156  Status = MiCreateImageFileMap (File, &Segment);
1157 
1158  }
1159  else {
1160 
1161  Status = MiCreateDataFileMap (File,
1162  &Segment,
1163  MaximumSize,
1164  SectionPageProtection,
1165  AllocationAttributes,
1166  IgnoreFileSizing);
1167  ASSERT (PreviousSectionPointer == File->SectionObjectPointer);
1168  }
1169 
1170  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
1171 
1172  //
1173  // Lock the PFN database and check to see if another thread has
1174  // tried to create a segment to the file object at the same
1175  // time.
1176  //
1177 
1178  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1179 
1180  Event = ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion;
1181  ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion = NULL;
1182  ASSERT (ControlArea->u.Flags.FilePointerNull == 0);
1183  ControlArea->u.Flags.FilePointerNull = 1;
1184 
1185  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
1186  MiRemoveImageSectionObject (File, ControlArea);
1187  }
1188  else {
1189  File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject = NULL;
1190  }
1191  ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated = 0;
1192 
1193  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1194 
1195  if (FileAcquired) {
1196  IoSetTopLevelIrp(NULL);
1197  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
1198  }
1199 
1200  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
1201 
1202  ObDereferenceObject (File);
1203 
1204  if (Event != NULL) {
1205 
1206  //
1207  // Signal any waiters that the segment structure exists.
1208  //
1209 
1210  KeSetEvent (&Event->Event, 0, FALSE);
1211  }
1212 
1213  return Status;
1214  }
1215 
1216  //
1217  // If the size was specified as zero, set the section size
1218  // from the created segment size. This solves problems with
1219  // race conditions when multiple sections
1220  // are created for the same mapped file with varying sizes.
1221  //
1222 
1223  if (*MaximumSize == 0) {
1224  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)Segment->SizeOfSegment;
1225  }
1226  else {
1227  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)*MaximumSize;
1228  }
1229  }
1230  }
1231  else {
1232 
1233  //
1234  // No file handle exists, this is a page file backed section.
1235  //
1236 
1237  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
1238  return STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
1239  }
1240 
1241  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_LARGE_PAGES) {
1242 
1243  if ((AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) == 0) {
1244  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_6;
1245  }
1246 
1247  if (!SeSinglePrivilegeCheck (SeLockMemoryPrivilege,
1248  KeGetPreviousMode())) {
1249 
1250  return STATUS_PRIVILEGE_NOT_HELD;
1251  }
1252  }
1253 
1254  Status = MiCreatePagingFileMap (&NewSegment,
1255  MaximumSize,
1256  ProtectionMask,
1257  AllocationAttributes);
1258 
1259  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
1260  return Status;
1261  }
1262 
1263  //
1264  // Set the section size from the created segment size. This
1265  // solves problems with race conditions when multiple sections
1266  // are created for the same mapped file with varying sizes.
1267  //
1268 
1269  Section.SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)NewSegment->SizeOfSegment;
1270  ControlArea = NewSegment->ControlArea;
1271 
1272  //
1273  // Set IncrementedRefCount so any failures from this point before the
1274  // object is created will result in the control area & segment getting
1275  // torn down - otherwise these could leak. This is because pagefile
1276  // backed sections are not (and should not be) added to the
1277  // dereference segment cache.
1278  //
1279 
1280  IncrementedRefCount = 1;
1281  }
1282 
1283  if (NewSegment == NULL) {
1284 
1285  //
1286  // A new segment had to be created. Lock the PFN database and
1287  // check to see if any other threads also tried to create a new segment
1288  // for this file object at the same time.
1289  //
1290 
1291  NewSegment = Segment;
1292 
1293  SegmentControlArea = Segment->ControlArea;
1294 
1295  ASSERT (File != NULL);
1296 
1297  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1298 
1299  Event = ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion;
1300  ControlArea->WaitingForDeletion = NULL;
1301 
1302  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) {
1303 
1304  //
1305  // Change the control area in the file object pointer.
1306  //
1307 
1308  MiRemoveImageSectionObject (File, NewControlArea);
1309  MiInsertImageSectionObject (File, SegmentControlArea);
1310 
1311  ControlArea = SegmentControlArea;
1312  }
1313  else if (SegmentControlArea->u.Flags.Rom == 1) {
1314  ASSERT (File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject == NewControlArea);
1315  File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject = SegmentControlArea;
1316 
1317  ControlArea = SegmentControlArea;
1318  }
1319 
1320  ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated = 0;
1321 
1322  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1323 
1324  if ((AllocationAttributes & SEC_IMAGE) ||
1325  (SegmentControlArea->u.Flags.Rom == 1)) {
1326 
1327  //
1328  // Deallocate the pool used for the original control area.
1329  //
1330 
1331  ExFreePool (NewControlArea);
1332  }
1333 
1334  if (Event != NULL) {
1335 
1336  //
1337  // Signal any waiters that the segment structure exists.
1338  //
1339 
1340  KeSetEvent (&Event->Event, 0, FALSE);
1341  }
1342  }
1343 
1344  //
1345  // Being created has now been cleared allowing other threads
1346  // to reference the segment. Release the resource on the file.
1347  //
1348 
1349  if (FileAcquired) {
1350  IoSetTopLevelIrp(NULL);
1351  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
1352  FileAcquired = FALSE;
1353  }
1354 
1355 ReferenceObject:
1356 
1357  //
1358  // Now that the segment object is created, make the section object
1359  // refer to the segment object.
1360  //
1361 
1362  Section.Segment = NewSegment;
1363  Section.u.LongFlags = ControlArea->u.LongFlags;
1364 
1365  //
1366  // Update the count of writable user sections so the transaction semantics
1367  // can be supported. Note that no lock synchronization is needed here as
1368  // the transaction manager must already check for any open writable handles
1369  // to the file - and no writable sections can be created without a writable
1370  // file handle. So all that needs to be provided is a way for the
1371  // transaction manager to know that there are lingering user views or
1372  // created sections still open that have write access.
1373  //
1374  // This must be done before creating the object so a rogue user program
1375  // that suspends this thread cannot subvert a transaction.
1376  //
1377 
1378  if ((FileObject == NULL) &&
1379  (SectionPageProtection & (PAGE_READWRITE|PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE)) &&
1380  (ControlArea->u.Flags.Image == 0) &&
1381  (ControlArea->FilePointer != NULL)) {
1382 
1383  Section.u.Flags.UserWritable = 1;
1384 
1385  InterlockedIncrement ((PLONG)&ControlArea->WritableUserReferences);
1386  }
1387 
1388  //
1389  // Create the section object now. The section object is created
1390  // now so that the error handling when the section object cannot
1391  // be created is simplified.
1392  //
1393 
1394  if ((ControlArea->u.Flags.Image == 1) || (ControlArea->FilePointer == NULL)) {
1395  PagedPoolCharge = sizeof (SECTION) + NewSegment->TotalNumberOfPtes * sizeof(MMPTE);
1396  SubsectionSize = sizeof (SUBSECTION);
1397  }
1398  else {
1399  PagedPoolCharge = 0;
1400  SubsectionSize = sizeof (MSUBSECTION);
1401  }
1402 
1403  if ((ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0) &&
1404  (ControlArea->u.Flags.Rom == 0)) {
1405 
1406  NonPagedPoolCharge = sizeof (CONTROL_AREA);
1407  Subsection = (PSUBSECTION)(ControlArea + 1);
1408  }
1409  else {
1410  NonPagedPoolCharge = sizeof(LARGE_CONTROL_AREA);
1411  Subsection = (PSUBSECTION)((PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA)ControlArea + 1);
1412  }
1413 
1414  do {
1415  NonPagedPoolCharge += SubsectionSize;
1416  Subsection = Subsection->NextSubsection;
1417  } while (Subsection != NULL);
1418 
1419  Status = ObCreateObject (PreviousMode,
1420  MmSectionObjectType,
1421  ObjectAttributes,
1422  PreviousMode,
1423  NULL,
1424  sizeof(SECTION),
1425  PagedPoolCharge,
1426  NonPagedPoolCharge,
1427  (PVOID *)&NewSection);
1428 
1429  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
1430 
1431  if ((FileObject == NULL) &&
1432  (SectionPageProtection & (PAGE_READWRITE|PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE)) &&
1433  (ControlArea->u.Flags.Image == 0) &&
1434  (ControlArea->FilePointer != NULL)) {
1435 
1436  ASSERT (Section.u.Flags.UserWritable == 1);
1437 
1438  InterlockedDecrement ((PLONG)&ControlArea->WritableUserReferences);
1439  }
1440 
1441  goto UnrefAndReturn;
1442  }
1443 
1444  RtlCopyMemory (NewSection, &Section, sizeof(SECTION));
1445  NewSection->Address.StartingVpn = 0;
1446 
1447  if (!IgnoreFileSizing) {
1448 
1449  //
1450  // Indicate that the cache manager is not the owner of this
1451  // section.
1452  //
1453 
1454  NewSection->u.Flags.UserReference = 1;
1455 
1456  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_NO_CHANGE) {
1457 
1458  //
1459  // Indicate that once the section is mapped, no protection
1460  // changes or freeing the mapping is allowed.
1461  //
1462 
1463  NewSection->u.Flags.NoChange = 1;
1464  }
1465 
1466  if (((SectionPageProtection & PAGE_READWRITE) |
1467  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE)) == 0) {
1468 
1469  //
1470  // This section does not support WRITE access, indicate
1471  // that changing the protection to WRITE results in COPY_ON_WRITE.
1472  //
1473 
1474  NewSection->u.Flags.CopyOnWrite = 1;
1475  }
1476 
1477  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_BASED) {
1478 
1479  NewSection->u.Flags.Based = 1;
1480 
1481  SectionBasedRoot = &MmSectionBasedRoot;
1482 
1483  //
1484  // This section is based at a unique address system wide.
1485  // Ensure it does not wrap the virtual address space as the
1486  // SECTION structure would have to widen to accommodate this and
1487  // it's not worth the performance penalty for the very few isolated
1488  // cases that would want this. Note that sections larger than the
1489  // address space can easily be created - it's just that beyond a
1490  // certain point you shouldn't specify SEC_BASED (anything this big
1491  // couldn't use a SEC_BASED section for anything anyway).
1492  //
1493 
1494  if ((UINT64)NewSection->SizeOfSection.QuadPart > (UINT64)MmHighSectionBase) {
1495  ObDereferenceObject (NewSection);
1496  return STATUS_NO_MEMORY;
1497  }
1498 
1499 #if defined(_WIN64)
1500  SizeOfSection = NewSection->SizeOfSection.QuadPart;
1501 #else
1502  SizeOfSection = NewSection->SizeOfSection.LowPart;
1503 #endif
1504 
1505  //
1506  // Get the allocation base mutex.
1507  //
1508 
1509  KeAcquireGuardedMutex (&MmSectionBasedMutex);
1510 
1511  Status2 = MiFindEmptyAddressRangeDownBasedTree (
1512  SizeOfSection,
1513  MmHighSectionBase,
1514  X64K,
1515  SectionBasedRoot,
1516  (PVOID *)&NewSection->Address.StartingVpn);
1517  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status2)) {
1518  KeReleaseGuardedMutex (&MmSectionBasedMutex);
1519  ObDereferenceObject (NewSection);
1520  return Status2;
1521  }
1522 
1523  NewSection->Address.EndingVpn = NewSection->Address.StartingVpn +
1524  SizeOfSection - 1;
1525 
1526  MiInsertBasedSection (NewSection);
1527  KeReleaseGuardedMutex (&MmSectionBasedMutex);
1528  }
1529  }
1530 
1531  //
1532  // If the cache manager is creating the section, set the was
1533  // purged flag as the file size can change.
1534  //
1535 
1536  ControlArea->u.Flags.WasPurged |= IgnoreFileSizing;
1537 
1538  //
1539  // Check to see if the section is for a data file and the size
1540  // of the section is greater than the current size of the
1541  // segment.
1542  //
1543 
1544  if (((ControlArea->u.Flags.WasPurged == 1) && (!IgnoreFileSizing)) &&
1545  (!FileSizeChecked)
1546  ||
1547  ((UINT64)NewSection->SizeOfSection.QuadPart >
1548  NewSection->Segment->SizeOfSegment)) {
1549 
1550  TempSectionSize = NewSection->SizeOfSection;
1551 
1552  NewSection->SizeOfSection.QuadPart = (LONGLONG)NewSection->Segment->SizeOfSegment;
1553 
1554  //
1555  // Even if the caller didn't specify extension rights, we enable it here
1556  // temporarily to make the section correct. Use a temporary section
1557  // instead of temporarily editing the real section to avoid opening
1558  // a security window that other concurrent threads could exploit.
1559  //
1560 
1561  if (((NewSection->InitialPageProtection & PAGE_READWRITE) |
1562  (NewSection->InitialPageProtection & PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE)) == 0) {
1563  SECTION WritableSection;
1564 
1565  *(PSECTION)&WritableSection = *NewSection;
1566 
1567  Status = MmExtendSection (&WritableSection,
1568  &TempSectionSize,
1569  IgnoreFileSizing);
1570 
1571  NewSection->SizeOfSection = WritableSection.SizeOfSection;
1572  }
1573  else {
1574  Status = MmExtendSection (NewSection,
1575  &TempSectionSize,
1576  IgnoreFileSizing);
1577  }
1578 
1579  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
1580  ObDereferenceObject (NewSection);
1581  return Status;
1582  }
1583  }
1584 
1585  *SectionObject = (PVOID)NewSection;
1586 
1587  return Status;
1588 
1589 UnrefAndReturn:
1590 
1591  //
1592  // Unreference the control area, if it was referenced and return
1593  // the error status.
1594  //
1595 
1596  if (FileAcquired) {
1597  IoSetTopLevelIrp(NULL);
1598  FsRtlReleaseFile (File);
1599  }
1600 
1601  if (IncrementedRefCount) {
1602  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1603  ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences -= 1;
1604  if (!IgnoreFileSizing) {
1605  ASSERT ((LONG)ControlArea->NumberOfUserReferences > 0);
1606  ControlArea->NumberOfUserReferences -= 1;
1607  }
1608  MiCheckControlArea (ControlArea, OldIrql);
1609  }
1610  return Status;
1611 }
1612 
1613 LOGICAL
1614 MiMakeControlAreaRom (
1615  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
1616  IN PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA ControlArea,
1617  IN PFN_NUMBER PageFrameNumber
1618  )
1619 
1620 /*++
1621 
1622 Routine Description:
1623 
1624  This function marks the control area as ROM-backed. It can fail if the
1625  parallel control area (image vs data) is currently active as ROM-backed
1626  as the same PFNs cannot be used for both control areas simultaneously.
1627 
1628 Arguments:
1629 
1630  ControlArea - Supplies the relevant control area.
1631 
1632  PageFrameNumber - Supplies the starting physical page frame number.
1633 
1634 Return Value:
1635 
1636  TRUE if the control area was marked as ROM-backed, FALSE if not.
1637 
1638 --*/
1639 
1640 {
1641  LOGICAL ControlAreaMarked;
1642  PCONTROL_AREA OtherControlArea;
1643  KIRQL OldIrql;
1644 
1645  ControlAreaMarked = FALSE;
1646 
1647  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1648 
1649  if (ControlArea->u.Flags.Image == 1) {
1650  OtherControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA) File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject;
1651  }
1652  else {
1653  OtherControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA) File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject;
1654  }
1655 
1656  //
1657  // This could be made smarter (ie: throw away the other control area if it's
1658  // not in use) but for now, keep it simple.
1659  //
1660 
1661  if ((OtherControlArea == NULL) || (OtherControlArea->u.Flags.Rom == 0)) {
1662  ControlArea->u.Flags.Rom = 1;
1663  ControlArea->StartingFrame = PageFrameNumber;
1664  ControlAreaMarked = TRUE;
1665  }
1666 
1667  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
1668 
1669  return ControlAreaMarked;
1670 }
1671 
1672 ULONG MiImageFailure;
1673 
1674 #define MI_BAD_IMAGE(x) MiImageFailure = x;
1675 
1676 
1677 NTSTATUS
1678 MiCreateImageFileMap (
1679  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
1680  OUT PSEGMENT *Segment
1681  )
1682 
1683 /*++
1684 
1685 Routine Description:
1686 
1687  This function creates the necessary structures to allow the mapping
1688  of an image file.
1689 
1690  The image file is opened and verified for correctness, a segment
1691  object is created and initialized based on data in the image
1692  header.
1693 
1694 Arguments:
1695 
1696  File - Supplies the file object for the image file.
1697 
1698  Segment - Returns the segment object.
1699 
1700 Return Value:
1701 
1702  NTSTATUS.
1703 
1704 --*/
1705 
1706 {
1707  PMMPFN Pfn1;
1708  PMMPFN Pfn2;
1709  LOGICAL CheckSplitPages;
1710  LOGICAL MarkModified;
1711  LOGICAL SingleSubsection;
1712  NTSTATUS Status;
