1779  LOGICAL ActiveDataReferences;
1780  PFN_NUMBER StackMdl[(sizeof(MDL)/sizeof(PFN_NUMBER)) + MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER / PAGE_SIZE];
1781  PMMPFN ImagePages;
1782 
1783 #define InvalidAlignmentAllowed FALSE
1784 
1785  PAGED_CODE ();
1786 
1787  MarkModified = TRUE;
1788  MarkHeaderModified = 0;
1789 
1790  Status = FsRtlGetFileSize (File, &EndOfFile);
1791 
1792  if (!NT_SUCCESS (Status)) {
1793 
1794  MI_BAD_IMAGE (1);
1795  if (Status == STATUS_FILE_IS_A_DIRECTORY) {
1796 
1797  //
1798  // Can't map a directory as a section - return an error.
1799  //
1800 
1801  return STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
1802  }
1803 
1804  return Status;
1805  }
1806 
1807  if (EndOfFile.HighPart != 0) {
1808 
1809  //
1810  // File too big. Return error.
1811  //
1812 
1813  return STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
1814  }
1815 
1816  CommitCharged = 0;
1817  ExtendedHeader = NULL;
1818  ControlArea = NULL;
1819  NewSegment = NULL;
1820 
1821  Mdl = (PMDL) &StackMdl;
1822 
1823  //
1824  // Read in the file header.
1825  //
1826  // Create an event and MDL for the read operation.
1827  //
1828 
1829  KeInitializeEvent (&InPageEvent, NotificationEvent, FALSE);
1830 
1831  MmInitializeMdl (Mdl, NULL, PAGE_SIZE);
1832 
1833  Mdl->MdlFlags |= MDL_PAGES_LOCKED;
1834 
1835  PageFrameNumber = MiGetPageForHeader (TRUE);
1836 
1837  ASSERT (PageFrameNumber != 0);
1838 
1839  Pfn1 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PageFrameNumber);
1840 
1841  ASSERT (Pfn1->u1.Flink == 0);
1842  ImagePages = Pfn1;
1843 
1844  Page = (PPFN_NUMBER)(Mdl + 1);
1845  *Page = PageFrameNumber;
1846 
1847  ZERO_LARGE (StartingOffset);
1848 
1849  CcZeroEndOfLastPage (File);
1850 
1851  //
1852  // Flush the data section if there is one.
1853  //
1854  // At the same time, capture whether there are any references to the
1855  // data control area. If so, flip the pages from the image control
1856  // area into pagefile backings to prevent anyone else's data writes
1857  // from changing the file after it is validated (this can happen if the
1858  // pages from the image control area need to be re-paged in later).
1859  //
1860 
1861  ActiveDataReferences = MiFlushDataSection (File);
1862 
1863  BasePte = NULL;
1864  Base = MiCopyHeaderIfResident (File, PageFrameNumber);
1865 
1866  if (Base == NULL) {
1867 
1868  ASSERT (Mdl->MdlFlags & MDL_PAGES_LOCKED);
1869 
1870  Status = IoPageRead (File,
1871  Mdl,
1872  &StartingOffset,
1873  &InPageEvent,
1874  &IoStatus);
1875 
1876  if (Status == STATUS_PENDING) {
1877  KeWaitForSingleObject (&InPageEvent,
1878  WrPageIn,
1879  KernelMode,
1880  FALSE,
1881  NULL);
1882 
1883  Status = IoStatus.Status;
1884  }
1885 
1886  if (Mdl->MdlFlags & MDL_MAPPED_TO_SYSTEM_VA) {
1887  MmUnmapLockedPages (Mdl->MappedSystemVa, Mdl);
1888  }
1889 
1890  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
1891  MI_BAD_IMAGE (2);
1892  if ((Status != STATUS_FILE_LOCK_CONFLICT) && (Status != STATUS_FILE_IS_OFFLINE)) {
1893  Status = STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
1894  }
1895  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1896  }
1897 
1898  BasePte = MiReserveSystemPtes (1, SystemPteSpace);
1899 
1900  if (BasePte == NULL) {
1901  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x25);
1902  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
1903  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1904  }
1905 
1906  ASSERT (BasePte->u.Hard.Valid == 0);
1907 
1908  Base = MiGetVirtualAddressMappedByPte (BasePte);
1909 
1910  TempPte = ValidKernelPte;
1911  TempPte.u.Hard.PageFrameNumber = PageFrameNumber;
1912 
1913  MI_WRITE_VALID_PTE (BasePte, TempPte);
1914 
1915  if (IoStatus.Information != PAGE_SIZE) {
1916 
1917  //
1918  // A full page was not read from the file, zero any remaining
1919  // bytes because this page will be cached if the section
1920  // creation succeeds.
1921  //
1922 
1923  if (IoStatus.Information < sizeof (IMAGE_DOS_HEADER)) {
1924  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_NOT_MZ;
1925  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x26);
1926  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1927  }
1928 
1929  RtlZeroMemory ((PVOID)((PCHAR)Base + IoStatus.Information),
1930  PAGE_SIZE - IoStatus.Information);
1931 
1932  //
1933  // Mark the PFN as modified so we don't lose the zeroing if
1934  // the page gets trimmed.
1935  //
1936 
1937  MarkHeaderModified = 1;
1938  }
1939  }
1940  else {
1941  IoStatus.Information = PAGE_SIZE;
1942 
1943  if (MI_HYPER_ADDRESS (Base)) {
1944  BasePte = MiGetPteAddress (Base);
1945  }
1946  }
1947 
1948  DosHeader = (PIMAGE_DOS_HEADER) Base;
1949 
1950  //
1951  // Check to determine if this is an NT image (PE format) or
1952  // a DOS image, Win-16 image, or OS/2 image. If the image is
1953  // not NT format, return an error indicating which image it
1954  // appears to be.
1955  //
1956 
1957  if (DosHeader->e_magic != IMAGE_DOS_SIGNATURE) {
1958 
1959  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_NOT_MZ;
1960  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1961  }
1962 
1963 #ifndef i386
1964  if (((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew & 3) != 0) {
1965 
1966  //
1967  // The image header is not aligned on a longword boundary.
1968  // Report this as an invalid protected mode image.
1969  //
1970 
1971  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
1972  MI_BAD_IMAGE (4);
1973  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1974  }
1975 #endif
1976 
1977  if ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew > EndOfFile.LowPart) {
1978  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
1979  MI_BAD_IMAGE (5);
1980  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1981  }
1982 
1983  if (((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew +
1984  sizeof(IMAGE_NT_HEADERS) +
1985  (16 * sizeof(IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER))) <= (ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew) {
1986  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
1987  MI_BAD_IMAGE (6);
1988  goto BadPeImageSegment;
1989  }
1990 
1991  if (((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew +
1992  sizeof(IMAGE_NT_HEADERS) +
1993  (16 * sizeof(IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER))) > PAGE_SIZE) {
1994 
1995  //
1996  // The PE header is not within the page already read or the
1997  // objects are in another page.
1998  // Build another MDL and read an additional 8k.
1999  //
2000 
2001  ExtendedHeader = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
2002  MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER,
2003  MMTEMPORARY);
2004  if (ExtendedHeader == NULL) {
2005  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
2006  MI_BAD_IMAGE (7);
2007  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2008  }
2009 
2010  //
2011  // Build an MDL for the operation.
2012  //
2013 
2014  MmInitializeMdl (Mdl, ExtendedHeader, MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER);
2015 
2016  MmBuildMdlForNonPagedPool (Mdl);
2017 
2018  StartingOffset.LowPart = PtrToUlong(PAGE_ALIGN ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew));
2019 
2020  KeClearEvent (&InPageEvent);
2021 
2022  Status = IoPageRead (File,
2023  Mdl,
2024  &StartingOffset,
2025  &InPageEvent,
2026  &IoStatus);
2027 
2028  if (Status == STATUS_PENDING) {
2029 
2030  KeWaitForSingleObject (&InPageEvent,
2031  WrPageIn,
2032  KernelMode,
2033  FALSE,
2034  NULL);
2035 
2036  Status = IoStatus.Status;
2037  }
2038 
2039  if (Mdl->MdlFlags & MDL_MAPPED_TO_SYSTEM_VA) {
2040  MmUnmapLockedPages (Mdl->MappedSystemVa, Mdl);
2041  }
2042 
2043  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
2044  MI_BAD_IMAGE (8);
2045  if ((Status != STATUS_FILE_LOCK_CONFLICT) && (Status != STATUS_FILE_IS_OFFLINE)) {
2046  Status = STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
2047  }
2048  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2049  }
2050 
2051  if (IoStatus.Information != MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER) {
2052 
2053  //
2054  // 2 full pages were not read from the file, no need to zero
2055  // any remaining bytes (unless we were to cache it), but do
2056  // check that the amount read covers the minimum NT header.
2057  //
2058 
2059  if (IoStatus.Information < BYTE_OFFSET ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew) + sizeof (IMAGE_NT_HEADERS)) {
2060  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
2061  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x18);
2062  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2063  }
2064  }
2065 
2066  NtHeader = (PIMAGE_NT_HEADERS)((PCHAR)ExtendedHeader +
2067  BYTE_OFFSET((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew));
2068 
2069  NtHeaderSize = (ULONG)IoStatus.Information -
2070  (ULONG)(BYTE_OFFSET((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew));
2071  }
2072  else if ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew + sizeof (IMAGE_NT_HEADERS) > IoStatus.Information) {
2073  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
2074  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x27);
2075  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2076  }
2077  else {
2078  NtHeader = (PIMAGE_NT_HEADERS)((PCHAR)DosHeader +
2079  (ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew);
2080  NtHeaderSize = (ULONG) IoStatus.Information - (ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew;
2081  }
2082 
2083  FileHeader = &NtHeader->FileHeader;
2084  FileHeaderNumberOfSections = FileHeader->NumberOfSections;
2085 
2086  //
2087  // Check to see if this is an NT image or a DOS or OS/2 image.
2088  //
2089 
2090  Status = MiVerifyImageHeader (NtHeader, DosHeader, NtHeaderSize);
2091  if (Status != STATUS_SUCCESS) {
2092  MI_BAD_IMAGE (9);
2093  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2094  }
2095 
2096  CheckSplitPages = FALSE;
2097 
2098 #if defined(_WIN64)
2099 
2100  //
2101  // Don't let bogus headers cause system alignment faults.
2102  //
2103 
2104  if (FileHeader->SizeOfOptionalHeader & (sizeof (ULONG_PTR) - 1)) {
2105  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2106  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0xE);
2107  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2108  }
2109 
2110  if (NtHeader->OptionalHeader.Magic != IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR32_MAGIC) {
2111  NtHeader32 = NULL;
2112 
2113 #endif
2114  ImageAlignment = NtHeader->OptionalHeader.SectionAlignment;
2115  FileAlignment = NtHeader->OptionalHeader.FileAlignment - 1;
2116  SizeOfImage = NtHeader->OptionalHeader.SizeOfImage;
2117  LoaderFlags = NtHeader->OptionalHeader.LoaderFlags;
2118  ImageBase = NtHeader->OptionalHeader.ImageBase;
2119  SizeOfHeaders = NtHeader->OptionalHeader.SizeOfHeaders;
2120 
2121  //
2122  // Read in the COM+ directory entry.
2123  //
2124 
2125  ComPlusDirectoryEntry = &NtHeader->OptionalHeader.DataDirectory[IMAGE_DIRECTORY_ENTRY_COM_DESCRIPTOR];
2126 
2127 #if defined (_WIN64)
2128  }
2129  else {
2130 
2131  //
2132  // The image is 32-bit. All code below this point must check
2133  // if NtHeader is NULL. If it is, then the image is PE32 and
2134  // NtHeader32 must be used.
2135  //
2136 
2137  NtHeader32 = (PIMAGE_NT_HEADERS32) NtHeader;
2138  NtHeader = NULL;
2139 
2140  ImageAlignment = NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.SectionAlignment;
2141  FileAlignment = NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.FileAlignment - 1;
2142  SizeOfImage = NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.SizeOfImage;
2143  LoaderFlags = NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.LoaderFlags;
2144  ImageBase = NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.ImageBase;
2145  SizeOfHeaders = NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.SizeOfHeaders;
2146 
2147  //
2148  // Read in the COM+ directory entry.
2149  //
2150 
2151  ComPlusDirectoryEntry = &NtHeader32->OptionalHeader.DataDirectory[IMAGE_DIRECTORY_ENTRY_COM_DESCRIPTOR];
2152  }
2153 #endif
2154 
2155  NumberOfPtes = BYTES_TO_PAGES (SizeOfImage);
2156 
2157  if (NumberOfPtes == 0) {
2158  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2159  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0xA);
2160  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2161  }
2162 
2163 #if defined (_WIN64)
2164  if (NumberOfPtes >= _4gb) {
2165  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2166  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0xB);
2167  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2168  }
2169 #endif
2170 
2171  //
2172  // Set the appropriate bit for .NET images inside the image's
2173  // section loader flags.
2174  //
2175 
2176  if ((ComPlusDirectoryEntry->VirtualAddress != 0) &&
2177  (ComPlusDirectoryEntry->Size != 0)) {
2178 
2179  LoaderFlags |= IMAGE_LOADER_FLAGS_COMPLUS;
2180  }
2181 
2182  RoundingAlignment = ImageAlignment;
2183  NumberOfSubsections = FileHeader->NumberOfSections;
2184 
2185  if ((ImageAlignment >= PAGE_SIZE) || (CheckSplitPages == TRUE)) {
2186 
2187  //
2188  // Allocate a control area and a subsection for each section
2189  // header plus one for the image header which has no section.
2190  //
2191 
2192  SubsectionsAllocated = NumberOfSubsections + 1;
2193 
2194  ControlArea = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
2195  sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) +
2196  (sizeof(SUBSECTION) *
2197  SubsectionsAllocated),
2198  'iCmM');
2199  SingleSubsection = FALSE;
2200  }
2201  else {
2202 
2203  //
2204  // The image alignment is less than the page size,
2205  // map the image with a single subsection.
2206  //
2207 
2208  ControlArea = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
2209  sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) + sizeof(SUBSECTION),
2210  MMCONTROL);
2211 
2212  SubsectionsAllocated = 1;
2213  SingleSubsection = TRUE;
2214  }
2215 
2216  if (ControlArea == NULL) {
2217 
2218  //
2219  // The requested pool could not be allocated.
2220  //
2221 
2222  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
2223  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0xC);
2224  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2225  }
2226 
2227  //
2228  // Zero the control area and the FIRST subsection.
2229  //
2230 
2231  RtlZeroMemory (ControlArea, sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) + sizeof(SUBSECTION));
2232 
2233  ASSERT (ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0);
2234 
2235  Subsection = (PSUBSECTION)(ControlArea + 1);
2236 
2237  SizeOfSegment = sizeof(SEGMENT) + (sizeof(MMPTE) * ((ULONG)NumberOfPtes - 1)) +
2238  sizeof(SECTION_IMAGE_INFORMATION);
2239 
2240  NewSegment = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (PagedPool | POOL_MM_ALLOCATION,
2241  SizeOfSegment,
2242  MMSECT);
2243 
2244  if (NewSegment == NULL) {
2245 
2246  //
2247  // The requested pool could not be allocated.
2248  //
2249 
2250  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0xD);
2251  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
2252  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2253  }
2254 
2255  *Segment = NewSegment;
2256 
2257  RtlZeroMemory (NewSegment, sizeof(SEGMENT));
2258 
2259  NewSegment->PrototypePte = &NewSegment->ThePtes[0];
2260 
2261  PointerPte = &NewSegment->ThePtes[0];
2262 
2263  Pfn1->u2.Blink = (PFN_NUMBER) PointerPte;
2264 
2265  NewSegment->ControlArea = ControlArea;
2266  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation =
2267  (PSECTION_IMAGE_INFORMATION)((PCHAR)NewSegment + sizeof(SEGMENT) +
2268  (sizeof(MMPTE) * (NumberOfPtes - 1)));
2269  NewSegment->TotalNumberOfPtes = (ULONG) NumberOfPtes;
2270  NewSegment->NonExtendedPtes = (ULONG) NumberOfPtes;
2271  NewSegment->SizeOfSegment = NumberOfPtes * PAGE_SIZE;
2272 
2273  RtlZeroMemory (NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation,
2274  sizeof (SECTION_IMAGE_INFORMATION));
2275 
2276  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->ImageFileSize = EndOfFile.LowPart;
2277 
2278 #if DBG
2279 
2280  //
2281  // Zero fill the prototype PTEs so they can be checked in the error
2282  // path to make sure no valid entries got left behind.
2283  //
2284 
2285  if (NumberOfPtes != 0) {
2286  MiZeroMemoryPte (PointerPte, NumberOfPtes);
2287  }
2288 
2289 #endif
2290 
2291 //
2292 // This code is built twice on the Win64 build - once for PE32+ and once for
2293 // PE32 images.
2294 //
2295 #define INIT_IMAGE_INFORMATION(OptHdr) { \
2296  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->TransferAddress = \
2297  (PVOID)((ULONG_PTR)((OptHdr).ImageBase) + \
2298  (OptHdr).AddressOfEntryPoint); \
2299  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->MaximumStackSize = \
2300  (OptHdr).SizeOfStackReserve; \
2301  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->CommittedStackSize = \
2302  (OptHdr).SizeOfStackCommit; \
2303  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->SubSystemType = \
2304  (OptHdr).Subsystem; \
2305  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->SubSystemMajorVersion = (USHORT)((OptHdr).MajorSubsystemVersion); \
2306  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->SubSystemMinorVersion = (USHORT)((OptHdr).MinorSubsystemVersion); \
2307  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->DllCharacteristics = \
2308  (OptHdr).DllCharacteristics; \
2309  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->ImageContainsCode = \
2310  (BOOLEAN)(((OptHdr).SizeOfCode != 0) || \
2311  ((OptHdr).AddressOfEntryPoint != 0)); \
2312  }
2313 
2314 #if defined (_WIN64)
2315  if (NtHeader) {
2316 #endif
2317  INIT_IMAGE_INFORMATION(NtHeader->OptionalHeader);
2318 #if defined (_WIN64)
2319  }
2320  else {
2321 
2322  //
2323  // The image is 32-bit so use the 32-bit header
2324  //
2325 
2326  INIT_IMAGE_INFORMATION(NtHeader32->OptionalHeader);
2327  }
2328 #endif
2329  #undef INIT_IMAGE_INFORMATION
2330 
2331  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->ImageCharacteristics =
2332  FileHeader->Characteristics;
2333  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->Machine = FileHeader->Machine;
2334  NewSegment->u2.ImageInformation->LoaderFlags = LoaderFlags;
2335 
2336  ControlArea->Segment = NewSegment;
2337  ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences = 1;
2338  ControlArea->NumberOfUserReferences = 1;
2339  ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated = 1;
2340  ControlArea->u.Flags.Image = 1;
2341  ControlArea->u.Flags.File = 1;
2342 
2343  if ((ActiveDataReferences == TRUE) ||
2344  (IoIsDeviceEjectable(File->DeviceObject)) ||
2345  ((FileHeader->Characteristics &
2346  IMAGE_FILE_REMOVABLE_RUN_FROM_SWAP) &&
2347  (FILE_REMOVABLE_MEDIA & File->DeviceObject->Characteristics)) ||
2348  ((FileHeader->Characteristics &
2349  IMAGE_FILE_NET_RUN_FROM_SWAP) &&
2350  (FILE_REMOTE_DEVICE & File->DeviceObject->Characteristics))) {
2351 
2352  //
2353  // This file resides on a floppy disk or a removable media or
2354  // network with flags set indicating it should be copied
2355  // to the paging file.
2356  //
2357 
2358  ControlArea->u.Flags.FloppyMedia = 1;
2359  }
2360 
2361 #if DBG
2362  if (MiMakeImageFloppy[0] & 0x1) {
2363  MiMakeImageFloppy[1] += 1;
2364  ControlArea->u.Flags.FloppyMedia = 1;
2365  }
2366 #endif
2367 
2368  if (FILE_REMOTE_DEVICE & File->DeviceObject->Characteristics) {
2369 
2370  //
2371  // This file resides on a redirected drive.
2372  //
2373 
2374  ControlArea->u.Flags.Networked = 1;
2375  }
2376 
2377  ControlArea->FilePointer = File;
2378 
2379  //
2380  // Build the subsection and prototype PTEs for the image header.
2381  //
2382 
2383  Subsection->ControlArea = ControlArea;
2384  NextVa = ImageBase;
2385 
2386  if ((NextVa & (X64K - 1)) != 0) {
2387 
2388  //
2389  // Image header is not aligned on a 64k boundary.
2390  //
2391 
2392  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2393  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0xF);
2394  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2395  }
2396 
2397  NewSegment->BasedAddress = (PVOID) NextVa;
2398 
2399 #if DBG
2400  if (NextVa != 0 && NextVa == MiMatchSectionBase) {
2401  DbgPrintEx (DPFLTR_MM_ID,
2402  DPFLTR_INFO_LEVEL,
2403  "MM: NewSegment %p being created\n",
2404  NewSegment);
2405  DbgBreakPoint ();
2406  }
2407 #endif
2408 
2409  if (SizeOfHeaders >= SizeOfImage) {
2410  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2411  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x10);
2412  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2413  }
2414 
2415  if (CheckSplitPages == FALSE) {
2416  Subsection->PtesInSubsection = MI_ROUND_TO_SIZE (SizeOfHeaders, ImageAlignment) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
2417  }
2418  else {
2419  Subsection->PtesInSubsection =
2420  (ULONG) MI_COMPUTE_PAGES_SPANNED (0,
2421  MI_ROUND_TO_SIZE (SizeOfHeaders, ImageAlignment));
2422  }
2423 
2424  PointerPte = NewSegment->PrototypePte;
2425  Subsection->SubsectionBase = PointerPte;
2426 
2427  TempPte.u.Long = MiGetSubsectionAddressForPte (Subsection);
2428  TempPte.u.Soft.Prototype = 1;
2429 
2430  NewSegment->SegmentPteTemplate = TempPte;
2431  SectorOffset = 0;
2432 
2433  if (SingleSubsection == TRUE) {
2434 
2435  //
2436  // The image is aligned on less than a page size boundary.
2437  // Initialize the single subsection to refer to the image.
2438  //
2439 
2440  PointerPte = NewSegment->PrototypePte;
2441 
2442  Subsection->PtesInSubsection = (ULONG) NumberOfPtes;
2443 
2444 #if !defined (_WIN64)
2445 
2446  //
2447  // Note this only needs to be checked for 32-bit systems as NT64
2448  // does a much more extensive reallocation of images that are built
2449  // with alignment less than PAGE_SIZE.
2450  //
2451 
2452  if ((UINT64)SizeOfImage < (UINT64)EndOfFile.QuadPart) {
2453 
2454  //
2455  // Images that have a size of image (according to the header) that's
2456  // smaller than the actual file only get that many prototype PTEs.
2457  // Initialize the subsection properly so no one can read off the
2458  // end as that would corrupt the PFN database element's original
2459  // PTE entry.
2460  //
2461 
2462  Subsection->NumberOfFullSectors = (SizeOfImage >> MMSECTOR_SHIFT);
2463 
2464  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.SectorEndOffset =
2465  SizeOfImage & MMSECTOR_MASK;
2466  }
2467  else {
2468 #endif
2469  Subsection->NumberOfFullSectors =
2470  (ULONG)(EndOfFile.QuadPart >> MMSECTOR_SHIFT);
2471 
2472  ASSERT ((ULONG)(EndOfFile.HighPart & 0xFFFFF000) == 0);
2473 
2474  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.SectorEndOffset =
2475  EndOfFile.LowPart & MMSECTOR_MASK;
2476 #if !defined (_WIN64)
2477  }
2478 #endif
2479 
2480  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.Protection = MM_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY;
2481 
2482  //
2483  // Set all the PTEs to the execute-read-write protection.
2484  // The section will control access to these and the segment
2485  // must provide a method to allow other users to map the file
2486  // for various protections.
2487  //
2488 
2489  TempPte.u.Soft.Protection = MM_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY;
2490 
2491  NewSegment->SegmentPteTemplate = TempPte;
2492 
2493  TempPteDemandZero.u.Long = 0;
2494  TempPteDemandZero.u.Soft.Protection = MM_EXECUTE_WRITECOPY;
2495  SectorOffset = 0;
2496 
2497  for (i = 0; i < NumberOfPtes; i += 1) {
2498 
2499  //
2500  // Set prototype PTEs.
2501  //
2502 
2503  if (SectorOffset < EndOfFile.LowPart) {
2504 
2505  //
2506  // Data resides on the disk, refer to the control section.
2507  //
2508 
2509  MI_WRITE_INVALID_PTE (PointerPte, TempPte);
2510 
2511  }
2512  else {
2513 
2514  //
2515  // Data does not reside on the disk, use Demand zero pages.
2516  //
2517 
2518  MI_WRITE_INVALID_PTE (PointerPte, TempPteDemandZero);
2519  }
2520 
2521  SectorOffset += PAGE_SIZE;
2522  PointerPte += 1;
2523  }
2524 
2525  NewSegment->u1.ImageCommitment = NumberOfPtes;
2526  }
2527  else {
2528 
2529  //
2530  // Alignment is PAGE_SIZE or greater (or the image is a 32-bit
2531  // 4K aligned image being run with ALTPTE support).
2532  //
2533 
2534  if (SizeOfHeaders == 0) {
2535  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x31);
2536  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2537  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2538  }
2539 
2540  if (MI_ROUND_WOULD_WRAP (SizeOfHeaders, ImageAlignment)) {
2541  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x32);
2542  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2543  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2544  }
2545 
2546  if (Subsection->PtesInSubsection > NumberOfPtes) {
2547 
2548  //
2549  // Inconsistent image, size does not agree with header.
2550  //
2551 
2552  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2553  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x11);
2554  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2555  }
2556 
2557  NumberOfPtes -= Subsection->PtesInSubsection;
2558 
2559  Subsection->NumberOfFullSectors = SizeOfHeaders >> MMSECTOR_SHIFT;
2560 
2561  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.SectorEndOffset =
2562  SizeOfHeaders & MMSECTOR_MASK;
2563 
2564  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.ReadOnly = 1;
2565  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.Protection = MM_READONLY;
2566 
2567  TempPte.u.Soft.Protection = MM_READONLY;
2568  NewSegment->SegmentPteTemplate = TempPte;
2569 
2570  for (i = 0; i < Subsection->PtesInSubsection; i += 1) {
2571 
2572  //
2573  // Set all the prototype PTEs to refer to the control section.
2574  //
2575 
2576  if (SectorOffset < SizeOfHeaders) {
2577  MI_WRITE_INVALID_PTE (PointerPte, TempPte);
2578  }
2579  else {
2580  MI_WRITE_ZERO_PTE (PointerPte);
2581  }
2582  SectorOffset += PAGE_SIZE;
2583  PointerPte += 1;
2584  }
2585 
2586  if (CheckSplitPages == FALSE) {
2587  NextVa += (i * PAGE_SIZE);
2588  }
2589  }
2590 
2591  //
2592  // Build the additional subsections.
2593  //
2594 
2595  PreferredImageBase = ImageBase;
2596 
2597  //
2598  // At this point the object table is read in (if it was not
2599  // already read in) and may displace the image header.
2600  //
2601 
2602  SectionTableEntry = NULL;
2603  OffsetToSectionTable = sizeof(ULONG) +
2604  sizeof(IMAGE_FILE_HEADER) +
2605  FileHeader->SizeOfOptionalHeader;
2606 
2607  if ((BYTE_OFFSET(NtHeader) + OffsetToSectionTable +
2608 #if defined (_WIN64)
2609  BYTE_OFFSET(NtHeader32) +
2610 #endif
2611  ((NumberOfSubsections + 1) *
2612  sizeof (IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER))) <= NtHeaderSize) {
2613 
2614  //
2615  // Section tables are within the header which was read.
2616  //
2617 
2618 #if defined(_WIN64)
2619  if (NtHeader32) {
2620  SectionTableEntry = (PIMAGE_SECTION_HEADER)((PCHAR)NtHeader32 +
2621  OffsetToSectionTable);
2622  }
2623  else
2624 #endif
2625  {
2626  SectionTableEntry = (PIMAGE_SECTION_HEADER)((PCHAR)NtHeader +
2627  OffsetToSectionTable);
2628  }
2629 
2630  }
2631  else {
2632 
2633  //
2634  // Has an extended header been read in and are the object
2635  // tables resident?
2636  //
2637 
2638  if (ExtendedHeader != NULL) {
2639 
2640 #if defined(_WIN64)
2641  if (NtHeader32) {
2642  SectionTableEntry = (PIMAGE_SECTION_HEADER)((PCHAR)NtHeader32 +
2643  OffsetToSectionTable);
2644  }
2645  else
2646 #endif
2647  {
2648  SectionTableEntry = (PIMAGE_SECTION_HEADER)((PCHAR)NtHeader +
2649  OffsetToSectionTable);
2650  }
2651 
2652  //
2653  // Is the whole range of object tables mapped by the
2654  // extended header?
2655  //
2656 
2657  if (NtHeaderSize < OffsetToSectionTable + (NumberOfSubsections * sizeof (IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER))) {
2658  SectionTableEntry = NULL;
2659  }
2660  }
2661  }
2662 
2663  if (SectionTableEntry == NULL) {
2664 
2665  SIZE_T BytesForSectionTableEntries;
2666 
2667  if ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew + OffsetToSectionTable + (NumberOfSubsections * sizeof (IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER)) <= (ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew) {
2668  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2669  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x34);
2670  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2671  }
2672 
2673  BytesForSectionTableEntries =
2674  BYTE_OFFSET (DosHeader->e_lfanew + OffsetToSectionTable) +
2675  (NumberOfSubsections * sizeof (IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER));
2676 
2677  if (BytesForSectionTableEntries > MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER) {
2678  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2679  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x35);
2680  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2681  }
2682 
2683  //
2684  // The section table entries are not in the same
2685  // pages as the other data already read in. Read in
2686  // the object table entries.
2687  //
2688 
2689  if (ExtendedHeader == NULL) {
2690  ExtendedHeader = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
2691  MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER,
2692  MMTEMPORARY);
2693  if (ExtendedHeader == NULL) {
2694  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
2695  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x12);
2696  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2697  }
2698 
2699  //
2700  // Build an MDL for the operation.
2701  //
2702 
2703  MmInitializeMdl (Mdl, ExtendedHeader, MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_HEADER);
2704 
2705  MmBuildMdlForNonPagedPool (Mdl);
2706  }
2707 
2708  StartingOffset.LowPart = PtrToUlong(PAGE_ALIGN (
2709  (ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew +
2710  OffsetToSectionTable));
2711 
2712  SectionTableEntry = (PIMAGE_SECTION_HEADER)((PCHAR)ExtendedHeader +
2713  BYTE_OFFSET((ULONG)DosHeader->e_lfanew +
2714  OffsetToSectionTable));
2715 
2716  KeClearEvent (&InPageEvent);
2717  Status = IoPageRead (File,
2718  Mdl,
2719  &StartingOffset,
2720  &InPageEvent,
2721  &IoStatus);
2722 
2723  if (Status == STATUS_PENDING) {
2724  KeWaitForSingleObject (&InPageEvent,
2725  WrPageIn,
2726  KernelMode,
2727  FALSE,
2728  (PLARGE_INTEGER)NULL);
2729  Status = IoStatus.Status;
2730  }
2731 
2732  if (Mdl->MdlFlags & MDL_MAPPED_TO_SYSTEM_VA) {
2733  MmUnmapLockedPages (Mdl->MappedSystemVa, Mdl);
2734  }
2735 
2736  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
2737  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x13);
2738  if ((Status != STATUS_FILE_LOCK_CONFLICT) && (Status != STATUS_FILE_IS_OFFLINE)) {
2739  Status = STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
2740  }
2741  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2742  }
2743 
2744  //
2745  // Ensure that the entire section table entry span was read.
2746  //
2747 
2748  if (IoStatus.Information < BYTE_OFFSET ((ULONG) DosHeader->e_lfanew + OffsetToSectionTable) + (NumberOfSubsections * sizeof (IMAGE_SECTION_HEADER))) {
2749  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2750  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x28);
2751  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2752  }
2753 
2754  //
2755  // From this point on NtHeader is only valid if it
2756  // was in the first page of the image, otherwise reading in
2757  // the object tables wiped it out.
2758  //
2759  }
2760 
2761  if ((SingleSubsection == TRUE) && (InvalidAlignmentAllowed == FALSE)) {
2762 
2763  //
2764  // The image header is no longer valid.
2765  //
2766  // Loop through all sections and make sure there is no
2767  // uninitialized data.
2768  //
2769 
2770  Status = STATUS_SUCCESS;
2771 
2772  while (NumberOfSubsections > 0) {
2773  if (SectionTableEntry->Misc.VirtualSize == 0) {
2774  SectionVirtualSize = SectionTableEntry->SizeOfRawData;
2775  }
2776  else {
2777  SectionVirtualSize = SectionTableEntry->Misc.VirtualSize;
2778  }
2779 
2780  //
2781  // If the raw pointer + raw size overflows a long word,
2782  // return an error.
2783  //
2784 
2785  if (SectionTableEntry->PointerToRawData +
2786  SectionTableEntry->SizeOfRawData <
2787  SectionTableEntry->PointerToRawData) {
2788 
2789  KdPrint(("MMCREASECT: invalid section/file size %Z\n",
2790  &File->FileName));
2791 
2792  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2793  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x14);
2794  break;
2795  }
2796 
2797  //
2798  // If the virtual size and address does not match the rawdata
2799  // and invalid alignments not allowed return an error.
2800  //
2801 
2802  if (((SectionTableEntry->PointerToRawData !=
2803  SectionTableEntry->VirtualAddress))
2804  ||
2805  (SectionVirtualSize > SectionTableEntry->SizeOfRawData)) {
2806 
2807  KdPrint(("MMCREASECT: invalid BSS/Trailingzero %Z\n",
2808  &File->FileName));
2809 
2810  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2811  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x15);
2812  break;
2813  }
2814 
2815  SectionTableEntry += 1;
2816  NumberOfSubsections -= 1;
2817  }
2818 
2819 
2820  if (!NT_SUCCESS(Status)) {
2821  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2822  }
2823 
2824  goto PeReturnSuccess;
2825  }
2826 
2827  if ((SingleSubsection == TRUE) && (InvalidAlignmentAllowed == TRUE)) {
2828 
2829  TempNumberOfSubsections = NumberOfSubsections;
2830  TempSectionTableEntry = SectionTableEntry;
2831 
2832  //
2833  // The image header is no longer valid.
2834  //
2835  // Loop through all sections and make sure there is no
2836  // uninitialized data.
2837  //
2838  // Also determine if there are shared data sections and
2839  // the number of extra PTEs they require.
2840  //
2841 
2842  AdditionalSubsections = 0;
2843  AdditionalPtes = 0;
2844  AdditionalBasePtes = 0;
2845  RoundingAlignment = PAGE_SIZE;
2846 
2847  while (TempNumberOfSubsections > 0) {
2848  ULONG EndOfSection;
2849  ULONG ExtraPages;
2850 
2851  if (TempSectionTableEntry->Misc.VirtualSize == 0) {
2852  SectionVirtualSize = TempSectionTableEntry->SizeOfRawData;
2853  }
2854  else {
2855  SectionVirtualSize = TempSectionTableEntry->Misc.VirtualSize;
2856  }
2857 
2858  EndOfSection = TempSectionTableEntry->PointerToRawData +
2859  TempSectionTableEntry->SizeOfRawData;
2860 
2861  //
2862  // If the raw pointer + raw size overflows a long word, return an error.
2863  //
2864 
2865  if (EndOfSection < TempSectionTableEntry->PointerToRawData) {
2866 
2867  KdPrint(("MMCREASECT: invalid section/file size %Z\n",
2868  &File->FileName));
2869 
2870  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2871  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x16);
2872 
2873  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2874  }
2875 
2876  //
2877  // If the section goes past SizeOfImage then allocate
2878  // additional PTEs. On x86 this is handled by the subsection
2879  // mapping. Note the additional data must be in memory so
2880  // it can be shuffled around later.
2881  //
2882 
2883  if ((EndOfSection <= EndOfFile.LowPart) &&
2884  (EndOfSection > SizeOfImage)) {
2885 
2886  //
2887  // Allocate enough PTEs to cover the end of this section.
2888  // Maximize with any other sections that extend beyond
2889  // SizeOfImage.
2890  //
2891 
2892  if (MI_ROUND_WOULD_WRAP (EndOfSection, RoundingAlignment)) {
2893  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2894  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x2A);
2895  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2896  }
2897 
2898  ExtraPages = MI_ROUND_TO_SIZE (EndOfSection, RoundingAlignment) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
2899  if ((ExtraPages > OrigNumberOfPtes) &&
2900  (ExtraPages - OrigNumberOfPtes > AdditionalBasePtes)) {
2901 
2902  AdditionalBasePtes = ExtraPages - (ULONG) OrigNumberOfPtes;
2903  }
2904  }
2905 
2906  //
2907  // Count number of shared data sections and additional PTEs needed.
2908  //
2909 
2910  if ((TempSectionTableEntry->Characteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_SHARED) &&
2911  (!(TempSectionTableEntry->Characteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_EXECUTE) ||
2912  (TempSectionTableEntry->Characteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_WRITE))) {
2913  ULONG PtesInThisSection;
2914 
2915  if (MI_ROUND_WOULD_WRAP (SectionVirtualSize, RoundingAlignment)) {
2916  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2917  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x2D);
2918  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2919  }
2920 
2921  PtesInThisSection =
2922  MI_ROUND_TO_SIZE (SectionVirtualSize, RoundingAlignment) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
2923 
2924  if ((PtesInThisSection != 0) &&
2925  (AdditionalPtes + PtesInThisSection <= AdditionalPtes)) {
2926 
2927  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2928  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x2E);
2929  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2930  }
2931 
2932  AdditionalPtes += PtesInThisSection;
2933  AdditionalSubsections += 1;
2934  }
2935 
2936  TempSectionTableEntry += 1;
2937  TempNumberOfSubsections -= 1;
2938  }
2939 
2940  if (AdditionalBasePtes == 0 && (AdditionalSubsections == 0 || AdditionalPtes == 0)) {
2941 
2942  //
2943  // No shared data sections.
2944  //
2945 
2946  goto PeReturnSuccess;
2947  }
2948 
2949  if (AdditionalBasePtes + AdditionalPtes < AdditionalBasePtes) {
2950  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x2F);
2951  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2952  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2953  }
2954 
2955  if (OrigNumberOfPtes + AdditionalBasePtes + AdditionalPtes < OrigNumberOfPtes) {
2956  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x30);
2957  Status = STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
2958  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2959  }
2960 
2961  //
2962  // Check that the new number of PTEs of PTEs cannot cause the
2963  // segment prototype PTE allocation size to wrap. Since originally
2964  // the number of PTEs came from the ULONG SizeOfImage in the
2965  // OptionalHeader, we know it was ok then. But adding various
2966  // subsection counts above may have pushed it over the limit.
2967  //
2968 
2969  if (((MAXULONG_PTR - (sizeof (SEGMENT) + sizeof (SECTION_IMAGE_INFORMATION))) / sizeof (MMPTE)) < OrigNumberOfPtes + AdditionalBasePtes + AdditionalPtes - 1) {
2970  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x33);
2971  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
2972  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2973  }
2974 
2975  //
2976  // There are additional base PTEs or shared data sections.
2977  // For shared sections, allocate new PTEs for these sections
2978  // at the end of the image. The usermode wow loader will change
2979  // fixups to point to the new pages.
2980  //
2981  // First reallocate the control area.
2982  //
2983 
2984  NewSubsectionsAllocated = SubsectionsAllocated + AdditionalSubsections;
2985 
2986  NewControlArea = ExAllocatePoolWithTag(NonPagedPool,
2987  (ULONG) (sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) +
2988  (sizeof(SUBSECTION) *
2989  NewSubsectionsAllocated)),
2990  'iCmM');
2991  if (NewControlArea == NULL) {
2992  MI_BAD_IMAGE (0x17);
2993  Status = STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
2994  goto BadPeImageSegment;
2995  }
2996 
2997  //

3705  MiReturnCommitment (CommitCharged);
3706  MM_TRACK_COMMIT (MM_DBG_COMMIT_RETURN_IMAGE_NO_LARGE_CA, CommitCharged);
3707  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&MmSharedCommit, 0 - CommitCharged);
3708  }
3709 
3710 #if DBG
3711 
3712  //
3713  // The wow reallocation code doesn't zero the extra PTEs so skip this
3714  // check for that case.
3715  //
3716 
3717  if (NewSegment->SegmentFlags.ExtraSharedWowSubsections == 0) {
3718 
3719  PointerPte = NewSegment->PrototypePte;
3720 
3721  for (i = 0; i < NewSegment->TotalNumberOfPtes; i += 1) {
3722 
3723  TempPte.u.Long = PointerPte->u.Long;
3724 
3725  ASSERT ((TempPte.u.Hard.Valid == 0) &&
3726  ((TempPte.u.Soft.Prototype == 1) ||
3727  (TempPte.u.Soft.Transition == 0)));
3728 
3729  PointerPte += 1;
3730  }
3731  }
3732 
3733 #endif
3734 
3735  }
3736 
3737  ASSERT ((ControlArea == NULL) || (ControlArea->NumberOfPfnReferences == 0));
3738 
3739  if (BasePte != NULL) {
3740  MiReleaseSystemPtes (BasePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
3741  }
3742 
3743  Pfn1 = ImagePages;
3744 
3745  do {
3746  Pfn2 = (PMMPFN) Pfn1->u1.Flink;
3747 
3748  Pfn1->u2.Blink = 0; // Clear prototype PTE pointer before freeing
3749 
3750  MiRemoveImageHeaderPage (Pfn1 - MmPfnDatabase);
3751 
3752  Pfn1 = Pfn2;
3753 
3754  } while (Pfn1 != NULL);
3755 
3756  ASSERT ((ControlArea == NULL) || (ControlArea->NumberOfPfnReferences == 0));
3757 
3758  if (NewSegment != NULL) {
3759  ExFreePool (NewSegment);
3760  }
3761 
3762  if (ControlArea != NULL) {
3763  ExFreePool (ControlArea);
3764  }
3765 
3766  if (ExtendedHeader != NULL) {
3767  ExFreePool (ExtendedHeader);
3768  }
3769 
3770  return Status;
3771 }
3772 
3773 
3774 LOGICAL
3775 MiCheckDosCalls (
3776  IN PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER Os2Header,
3777  IN ULONG HeaderSize
3778  )
3779 
3780 /*++
3781 
3782 Routine Description:
3783 
3784  This routine checks for DOS calls.
3785 
3786 Arguments:
3787 
3788  Os2Header - Supplies a kernelmode pointer to the OS2 header.
3789 
3790  HeaderSize - Supplies the length in bytes of the mapped header.
3791 
3792 Return Value:
3793 
3794  Returns TRUE if this is a Win-16 image, FALSE if not.
3795 
3796 --*/
3797 
3798 {
3799  PUCHAR ImportTable;
3800  UCHAR EntrySize;
3801  USHORT ModuleCount;
3802  USHORT ModuleSize;
3803  USHORT i;
3804  PUSHORT ModuleTable;
3805 
3806  PAGED_CODE();
3807 
3808  //
3809  // If there are no modules to check return immediately.
3810  //
3811 
3812  ModuleCount = Os2Header->ne_cmod;
3813 
3814  if (ModuleCount == 0) {
3815  return FALSE;
3816  }
3817 
3818  //
3819  // exe headers are notorious for having junk values for offsets
3820  // in the import table and module table so the header must be very
3821  // carefully validated.
3822  //
3823 
3824  //
3825  // Find out where the Module ref table is. Mod table has two byte
3826  // for each entry in import table. These two bytes tell the offset
3827  // in the import table for that entry.
3828  //
3829 
3830  ModuleTable = (PUSHORT)((PCHAR)Os2Header + (ULONG)Os2Header->ne_modtab);
3831 
3832  //
3833  // Make sure that the module table fits within the passed-in header.
3834  // Note that each module table entry is 2 bytes long.
3835  //
3836 
3837  if (((ULONG)Os2Header->ne_modtab + (ModuleCount * 2)) > HeaderSize) {
3838  return FALSE;
3839  }
3840 
3841  //
3842  // Now search individual entries for DOSCALLs.
3843  //
3844 
3845  for (i = 0; i < ModuleCount; i += 1) {
3846 
3847  ModuleSize = *((UNALIGNED USHORT *)ModuleTable);
3848 
3849  //
3850  // Import table has count byte followed by the string where count
3851  // is the string length.
3852  //
3853 
3854  ImportTable = (PUCHAR)((PCHAR)Os2Header +
3855  (ULONG)Os2Header->ne_imptab + (ULONG)ModuleSize);
3856 
3857  //
3858  // Make sure the offset is within the valid range.
3859  //
3860 
3861  if (((ULONG)Os2Header->ne_imptab + (ULONG)ModuleSize) >= HeaderSize) {
3862  return FALSE;
3863  }
3864 
3865  EntrySize = *ImportTable++;
3866 
3867  //
3868  // 0 is a bad size, bail out.
3869  //
3870 
3871  if (EntrySize == 0) {
3872  return FALSE;
3873  }
3874 
3875  //
3876  // Make sure the offset is within the valid range.
3877  // The sizeof(UCHAR) is included in the check because ImportTable
3878  // was incremented above and is used in the RtlEqualMemory
3879  // comparison below.
3880  //
3881 
3882  if (((ULONG)Os2Header->ne_imptab + (ULONG)ModuleSize +
3883  (ULONG)EntrySize + sizeof(UCHAR)) > HeaderSize) {
3884  return FALSE;
3885  }
3886 
3887  //
3888  // If size matches compare DOSCALLS.
3889  //
3890 
3891  if (EntrySize == 8) {
3892  if (RtlEqualMemory (ImportTable, "DOSCALLS", 8)) {
3893  return TRUE;
3894  }
3895  }
3896 
3897  //
3898  // Move on to the next module table entry. Each entry is 2 bytes.
3899  //
3900 
3901  ModuleTable = (PUSHORT)((PCHAR)ModuleTable + 2);
3902  }
3903 
3904  return FALSE;
3905 }
3906 
3907 
3908 NTSTATUS
3909 MiVerifyImageHeader (
3910  IN PIMAGE_NT_HEADERS NtHeader,
3911  IN PIMAGE_DOS_HEADER DosHeader,
3912  IN ULONG NtHeaderSize
3913  )
3914 
3915 /*++
3916 
3917 Routine Description:
3918 
3919  This function checks for various inconsistencies in the image header.
3920 
3921 Arguments:
3922 
3923  NtHeader - Supplies a pointer to the NT header of the image.
3924 
3925  DosHeader - Supplies a pointer to the DOS header of the image.
3926 
3927  NtHeaderSize - Supplies the size in bytes of the NT header.
3928 
3929 Return Value:
3930 
3931  NTSTATUS.
3932 
3933 --*/
3934 
3935 {
3936  PCONFIGPHARLAP PharLapConfigured;
3937  PUCHAR pb;
3938  LONG pResTableAddress;
3939 
3940  PAGED_CODE();
3941 
3942  if (NtHeader->Signature != IMAGE_NT_SIGNATURE) {
3943  if ((USHORT)NtHeader->Signature == (USHORT)IMAGE_OS2_SIGNATURE) {
3944 
3945  //
3946  // Check to see if this is a win-16 image.
3947  //
3948 
3949  if ((!MiCheckDosCalls ((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader, NtHeaderSize)) &&
3950  ((((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_exetyp == 2)
3951  ||
3952  ((((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_exetyp == 0) &&
3953  (((((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_expver & 0xff00) ==
3954  0x200) ||
3955  ((((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_expver & 0xff00) ==
3956  0x300))))) {
3957 
3958  //
3959  // This is a win-16 image.
3960  //
3961 
3962  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_WIN_16;
3963  }
3964 
3965  // The following OS/2 headers types go to NTDOS
3966  //
3967  // - exetype == 5 means binary is for Dos 4.0.
3968  // e.g Borland Dos extender type
3969  //
3970  // - OS/2 apps which have no import table entries
3971  // cannot be meant for the OS/2 ss.
3972  // e.g. QuickC for dos binaries
3973  //
3974  // - "old" Borland Dosx BC++ 3.x, Paradox 4.x
3975  // exe type == 1
3976  // DosHeader->e_cs * 16 + DosHeader->e_ip + 0x200 - 10
3977  // contains the string " mode EXE$"
3978  // but import table is empty, so we don't make special check
3979  //
3980 
3981  if (((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_exetyp == 5 ||
3982  ((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_enttab ==
3983  ((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_imptab) {
3984 
3985  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
3986  }
3987 
3988 
3989  //
3990  // Borland Dosx types: exe type 1
3991  //
3992  // - "new" Borland Dosx BP7.0
3993  // exe type == 1
3994  // DosHeader + 0x200 contains the string "16STUB"
3995  // 0x200 happens to be e_parhdr*16
3996  //
3997 
3998  if (((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_exetyp == 1 &&
3999  RtlEqualMemory((PUCHAR)DosHeader + 0x200, "16STUB", 6)) {
4000 
4001  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4002  }
4003 
4004  //
4005  // Check for PharLap extended header which we run as a dos app.
4006  // The PharLap config block is pointed to by the SizeofHeader
4007  // field in the DosHdr.
4008  // The following algorithm for detecting a pharlap exe
4009  // was recommended by PharLap Software Inc.
4010  //
4011 
4012  PharLapConfigured =(PCONFIGPHARLAP) ((PCHAR)DosHeader +
4013  ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_cparhdr << 4));
4014 
4015  if ((PCHAR)PharLapConfigured <
4016  (PCHAR)DosHeader + PAGE_SIZE - sizeof(CONFIGPHARLAP)) {
4017  if (RtlEqualMemory(&PharLapConfigured->uchCopyRight[0x18],
4018  "Phar Lap Software, Inc.", 24) &&
4019  (PharLapConfigured->usSign == 0x4b50 || // stub loader type 2
4020  PharLapConfigured->usSign == 0x4f50 || // bindable 286|DosExtender
4021  PharLapConfigured->usSign == 0x5650 )) // bindable 286|DosExtender (Adv)
4022  {
4023  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4024  }
4025  }
4026 
4027 
4028 
4029  //
4030  // Check for Rational extended header which we run as a dos app.
4031  // We look for the rational copyright at:
4032  // wCopyRight = *(DosHeader->e_cparhdr*16 + 30h)
4033  // pCopyRight = wCopyRight + DosHeader->e_cparhdr*16
4034  // "Copyright (C) Rational Systems, Inc."
4035  //
4036 
4037  pb = ((PUCHAR)DosHeader + ((ULONG)DosHeader->e_cparhdr << 4));
4038 
4039  if ((ULONG_PTR)pb < (ULONG_PTR)DosHeader + PAGE_SIZE - 0x30 - sizeof(USHORT)) {
4040  pb += *(PUSHORT)(pb + 0x30);
4041  if ((ULONG_PTR)pb < (ULONG_PTR)DosHeader + PAGE_SIZE - 36 &&
4042  RtlEqualMemory(pb,
4043  "Copyright (C) Rational Systems, Inc.",
4044  36))
4045  {
4046  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4047  }
4048  }
4049 
4050  //
4051  // Check for lotus 123 family of applications. Starting
4052  // with 123 3.0 (till recently shipped 123 3.4), every
4053  // exe header is bound but is meant for DOS. This can
4054  // be checked via, a string signature in the extended
4055  // header. <len byte>"1-2-3 Preloader" is the string
4056  // at ne_nrestab offset.
4057  //
4058 
4059  pResTableAddress = ((PIMAGE_OS2_HEADER)NtHeader)->ne_nrestab;
4060  if (pResTableAddress > DosHeader->e_lfanew &&
4061  ((ULONG)((pResTableAddress+16) - DosHeader->e_lfanew) <
4062  NtHeaderSize) &&
4063  RtlEqualMemory(
4064  ((PUCHAR)NtHeader + 1 +
4065  (ULONG)(pResTableAddress - DosHeader->e_lfanew)),
4066  "1-2-3 Preloader",
4067  15)) {
4068  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4069  }
4070 
4071  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_NE_FORMAT;
4072  }
4073 
4074  if ((USHORT)NtHeader->Signature == (USHORT)IMAGE_OS2_SIGNATURE_LE) {
4075 
4076  //
4077  // This is a LE (OS/2) image. We don't support it, so give it to
4078  // DOS subsystem. There are cases (Rbase.exe) which have a LE
4079  // header but actually it is suppose to run under DOS. When we
4080  // do support LE format, some work needs to be done here to
4081  // decide whether to give it to VDM or OS/2.
4082  //
4083 
4084  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4085  }
4086  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4087  }
4088 
4089  if ((NtHeader->FileHeader.Machine == 0) &&
4090  (NtHeader->FileHeader.SizeOfOptionalHeader == 0)) {
4091 
4092  //
4093  // This is a bogus DOS app which has a 32-bit portion
4094  // masquerading as a PE image.
4095  //
4096 
4097  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_PROTECT;
4098  }
4099 
4100  if (!(NtHeader->FileHeader.Characteristics & IMAGE_FILE_EXECUTABLE_IMAGE)) {
4101  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
4102  }
4103 
4104 #ifdef i386
4105 
4106  //
4107  // Make sure the image header is aligned on a Long word boundary.
4108  //
4109 
4110  if (((ULONG_PTR)NtHeader & 3) != 0) {
4111  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
4112  }
4113 #endif
4114 
4115 #define VALIDATE_NTHEADER(Hdr) { \
4116  /* File alignment must be multiple of 512 and power of 2. */ \
4117  if (((((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).FileAlignment & 511) != 0) && \
4118  (((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).FileAlignment != \
4119  ((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).SectionAlignment)) { \
4120  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4121  } \
4122  \
4123  if (((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).FileAlignment == 0) { \
4124  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4125  } \
4126  \
4127  /* Section alignment must be a power of 2 to use MI_ROUND */ \
4128  if (((((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).SectionAlignment - 1) & \
4129  ((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).SectionAlignment) != 0) { \
4130  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4131  } \
4132  \
4133  if (((((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).FileAlignment - 1) & \
4134  ((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).FileAlignment) != 0) { \
4135  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4136  } \
4137  \
4138  if (((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).SectionAlignment < ((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).FileAlignment) { \
4139  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4140  } \
4141  \
4142  if (((Hdr)->OptionalHeader).SizeOfImage > MM_SIZE_OF_LARGEST_IMAGE) { \
4143  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4144  } \
4145  \
4146  if ((Hdr)->FileHeader.NumberOfSections > MM_MAXIMUM_IMAGE_SECTIONS) { \
4147  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4148  } \
4149  \
4150  if (((Hdr)->OptionalHeader.Magic == IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR32_MAGIC) && \
4151  !((Hdr)->FileHeader.Machine == IMAGE_FILE_MACHINE_I386)) { \
4152  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4153  } \
4154  \
4155  if (((Hdr)->OptionalHeader.Magic == IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR64_MAGIC) && \
4156  !(((Hdr)->FileHeader.Machine == IMAGE_FILE_MACHINE_IA64) || \
4157  ((Hdr)->FileHeader.Machine == IMAGE_FILE_MACHINE_AMD64))) { \
4158  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT; \
4159  } \
4160 }
4161 
4162  if (NtHeader->OptionalHeader.Magic != IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR_MAGIC) {
4163 
4164  //
4165  // Image doesn't have the right magic value in its optional header.
4166  //
4167 
4168 #if defined (_WIN64)
4169  if (NtHeader->OptionalHeader.Magic == IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR32_MAGIC) {
4170 
4171  //
4172  // PE32 image. Validate it as such.
4173  //
4174 
4175  PIMAGE_NT_HEADERS32 NtHeader32 = (PIMAGE_NT_HEADERS32)NtHeader;
4176 
4177  VALIDATE_NTHEADER(NtHeader32);
4178  return STATUS_SUCCESS;
4179  }
4180 #else /* !defined(_WIN64) */
4181  if (NtHeader->OptionalHeader.Magic == IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR64_MAGIC) {
4182 
4183  //
4184  // 64bit image on a 32bit machine.
4185  //
4186  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_WIN_64;
4187  }
4188 #endif
4189  return STATUS_INVALID_IMAGE_FORMAT;
4190  }
4191 
4192  VALIDATE_NTHEADER(NtHeader);
4193  #undef VALIDATE_NTHEADER
4194 
4195  return STATUS_SUCCESS;
4196 }
4197 
4198 NTSTATUS
4199 MiCreateDataFileMap (
4200  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
4201  OUT PSEGMENT *Segment,
4202  IN PUINT64 MaximumSize,
4203  IN ULONG SectionPageProtection,
4204  IN ULONG AllocationAttributes,
4205  IN ULONG IgnoreFileSizing
4206  )
4207 
4208 /*++
4209 
4210 Routine Description:
4211 
4212  This function creates the necessary structures to allow the mapping
4213  of a data file.
4214 
4215  The data file is accessed to verify desired access, a segment
4216  object is created and initialized.
4217 
4218 Arguments:
4219 
4220  File - Supplies the file object for the image file.
4221 
4222  Segment - Returns the segment object.
4223 
4224  MaximumSize - Supplies the maximum size for the mapping.
4225 
4226  SectionPageProtection - Supplies the initial page protection.
4227 
4228  AllocationAttributes - Supplies the allocation attributes for the mapping.
4229 
4230  IgnoreFileSizing - Supplies TRUE if the cache manager is specifying the
4231  file size and so it does not need to be validated.
4232 
4233 Return Value:
4234 
4235  NTSTATUS.
4236 
4237 --*/
4238 
4239 {
4240  NTSTATUS Status;
4241  ULONG j;
4242  ULONG Size;
4243  UINT64 PartialSize;
4244  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
4245  PMAPPED_FILE_SEGMENT NewSegment;
4246  PMSUBSECTION Subsection;
4247  PMSUBSECTION ExtendedSubsection;
4248  MMPTE TempPte;
4249  UINT64 EndOfFile;
4250  UINT64 LastFileChunk;
4251  UINT64 FileOffset;
4252  UINT64 NumberOfPtesForEntireFile;
4253  ULONG ExtendedSubsections;
4254  PMSUBSECTION Last;
4255  ULONG NumberOfNewSubsections;
4256  SIZE_T AllocationFragment;
4257 
4258  PAGED_CODE();
4259 
4260  ExtendedSubsections = 0;
4261 
4262  // *************************************************************
4263  // Create mapped file section.
4264  // *************************************************************
4265 
4266  if (!IgnoreFileSizing) {
4267 
4268  Status = FsRtlGetFileSize (File, (PLARGE_INTEGER)&EndOfFile);
4269 
4270  if (Status == STATUS_FILE_IS_A_DIRECTORY) {
4271 
4272  //
4273  // Can't map a directory as a section. Return error.
4274  //
4275 
4276  return STATUS_INVALID_FILE_FOR_SECTION;
4277  }
4278 
4279  if (!NT_SUCCESS (Status)) {
4280  return Status;
4281  }
4282 
4283  if (EndOfFile == 0 && *MaximumSize == 0) {
4284 
4285  //
4286  // Can't map a zero length without specifying the maximum
4287  // size as non-zero.
4288  //
4289 
4290  return STATUS_MAPPED_FILE_SIZE_ZERO;
4291  }
4292 
4293  //
4294  // Make sure this file is big enough for the section.
4295  //
4296 
4297  if (*MaximumSize > EndOfFile) {
4298 
4299  //
4300  // If the maximum size is greater than the end-of-file,
4301  // and the user did not request page_write or page_execute_readwrite
4302  // to the section, reject the request.
4303  //
4304 
4305  if (((SectionPageProtection & PAGE_READWRITE) |
4306  (SectionPageProtection & PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE)) == 0) {
4307 
4308  return STATUS_SECTION_TOO_BIG;
4309  }
4310 
4311  //
4312  // Check to make sure that the allocation size large enough
4313  // to contain all the data, if not set a new allocation size.
4314  //
4315 
4316  EndOfFile = *MaximumSize;
4317 
4318  Status = FsRtlSetFileSize (File, (PLARGE_INTEGER)&EndOfFile);
4319 
4320  if (!NT_SUCCESS (Status)) {
4321  return Status;
4322  }
4323  }
4324  }
4325  else {
4326 
4327  //
4328  // Ignore the file size, this call is from the cache manager.
4329  //
4330 
4331  EndOfFile = *MaximumSize;
4332  }
4333 
4334  //
4335  // Calculate the number of prototype PTE chunks to build for this section.
4336  // A subsection is also allocated for each chunk as all the prototype PTEs
4337  // in any given chunk are initially encoded to point at the same subsection.
4338  //
4339  // The maximum total section size is 16PB (2^54). This is because the
4340  // StartingSector4132 field in each subsection, ie: 2^42-1 bits of file
4341  // offset where the offset is in 4K (not pagesize) units. Thus, a
4342  // subsection may describe a *BYTE* file start offset of maximum
4343  // 2^54 - 4K.
4344  //
4345  // Each subsection can span at most 16TB - 64K. This is because the
4346  // NumberOfFullSectors and various other fields in the subsection are
4347  // ULONGs. In reality, this is a nonissue as far as maximum section size
4348  // is concerned because any number of subsections can be chained together
4349  // and in fact, subsections are allocated to span less to facilitate
4350  // efficient dynamic prototype PTE trimming and reconstruction.
4351  //
4352 
4353  if (EndOfFile > MI_MAXIMUM_SECTION_SIZE) {
4354  return STATUS_SECTION_TOO_BIG;
4355  }
4356 
4357  NumberOfPtesForEntireFile = (EndOfFile + PAGE_SIZE - 1) >> PAGE_SHIFT;
4358 
4359  NewSegment = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (PagedPool,
4360  sizeof(MAPPED_FILE_SEGMENT),
4361  'mSmM');
4362 
4363  if (NewSegment == NULL) {
4364  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
4365  }
4366 
4367  //
4368  // Allocate the subsection memory in smaller sizes so the corresponding
4369  // prototype PTEs can be trimmed later if paged pool virtual address
4370  // space becomes scarce. Note the size is snapped locally so it can
4371  // be changed dynamically without locking.
4372  //
4373 
4374  AllocationFragment = MmAllocationFragment;
4375 
4376  ASSERT (MiGetByteOffset (AllocationFragment) == 0);
4377  ASSERT (AllocationFragment >= PAGE_SIZE);
4378  ASSERT64 (AllocationFragment < _4gb);
4379 
4380  Size = (ULONG) AllocationFragment;
4381  PartialSize = NumberOfPtesForEntireFile * sizeof(MMPTE);
4382 
4383  NumberOfNewSubsections = 0;
4384  ExtendedSubsection = NULL;
4385 
4386  //
4387  // Initializing Last is not needed for correctness, but without it the
4388  // compiler cannot compile this code W4 to check for use of uninitialized
4389  // variables.
4390  //
4391 
4392  Last = NULL;
4393 
4394  ControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA)File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject;
4395 
4396  do {
4397 
4398  if (PartialSize < (UINT64) AllocationFragment) {
4399  PartialSize = (UINT64) ROUND_TO_PAGES (PartialSize);
4400  Size = (ULONG) PartialSize;
4401  }
4402 
4403  if (ExtendedSubsection == NULL) {
4404  ExtendedSubsection = (PMSUBSECTION)(ControlArea + 1);
4405 
4406  //
4407  // Control area and first subsection were zeroed at allocation time.
4408  //
4409  }
4410  else {
4411 
4412  ExtendedSubsection = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
4413  sizeof(MSUBSECTION),
4414  'cSmM');
4415 
4416  if (ExtendedSubsection == NULL) {
4417  ExFreePool (NewSegment);
4418 
4419  //
4420  // Free all the previous allocations and return an error.
4421  //
4422 
4423  ExtendedSubsection = (PMSUBSECTION)(ControlArea + 1);
4424  ExtendedSubsection = (PMSUBSECTION) ExtendedSubsection->NextSubsection;
4425  while (ExtendedSubsection != NULL) {
4426  Last = (PMSUBSECTION) ExtendedSubsection->NextSubsection;
4427  ExFreePool (ExtendedSubsection);
4428  ExtendedSubsection = Last;
4429  }
4430  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
4431  }
4432 
4433  RtlZeroMemory (ExtendedSubsection, sizeof(MSUBSECTION));
4434  Last->NextSubsection = (PSUBSECTION) ExtendedSubsection;
4435  }
4436 
4437  NumberOfNewSubsections += 1;
4438 
4439  ExtendedSubsection->PtesInSubsection = Size / sizeof(MMPTE);
4440 
4441  Last = ExtendedSubsection;
4442  PartialSize -= Size;
4443  } while (PartialSize != 0);
4444 
4445  *Segment = (PSEGMENT) NewSegment;
4446  RtlZeroMemory (NewSegment, sizeof(MAPPED_FILE_SEGMENT));
4447 
4448  NewSegment->LastSubsectionHint = ExtendedSubsection;
4449 
4450  //
4451  // Control area and first subsection were zeroed at allocation time.
4452  //
4453 
4454  ControlArea->Segment = (PSEGMENT) NewSegment;
4455  ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences = 1;
4456 
4457  if (IgnoreFileSizing == FALSE) {
4458 
4459  //
4460  // This reference is not from the cache manager.
4461  //
4462 
4463  ControlArea->NumberOfUserReferences = 1;
4464  }
4465  else {
4466 
4467  //
4468  // Set the was purged flag to indicate that the
4469  // file size was not explicitly set.
4470  //
4471 
4472  ControlArea->u.Flags.WasPurged = 1;
4473  }
4474 
4475  ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated = 1;
4476  ControlArea->u.Flags.File = 1;
4477 
4478  if (FILE_REMOTE_DEVICE & File->DeviceObject->Characteristics) {
4479 
4480  //
4481  // This file resides on a redirected drive.
4482  //
4483 
4484  ControlArea->u.Flags.Networked = 1;
4485  }
4486 
4487  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_NOCACHE) {
4488  ControlArea->u.Flags.NoCache = 1;
4489  }
4490 
4491  ControlArea->FilePointer = File;
4492 
4493  ASSERT (ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0);
4494 
4495  Subsection = (PMSUBSECTION)(ControlArea + 1);
4496 
4497  //
4498  // Loop through all the subsections and fill in the PTEs.
4499  //
4500 
4501  TempPte.u.Long = MiGetSubsectionAddressForPte (Subsection);
4502  TempPte.u.Soft.Prototype = 1;
4503 
4504  //
4505  // Set all the PTEs to the execute-read-write protection.
4506  // The section will control access to these and the segment
4507  // must provide a method to allow other users to map the file
4508  // for various protections.
4509  //
4510 
4511  TempPte.u.Soft.Protection = MM_EXECUTE_READWRITE;
4512 
4513  NewSegment->ControlArea = ControlArea;
4514  NewSegment->SizeOfSegment = EndOfFile;
4515  NewSegment->TotalNumberOfPtes = (ULONG) NumberOfPtesForEntireFile;
4516  if (NumberOfPtesForEntireFile >= 0x100000000) {
4517  NewSegment->SegmentFlags.TotalNumberOfPtes4132 = (ULONG_PTR)(NumberOfPtesForEntireFile >> 32);
4518  }
4519 
4520  NewSegment->SegmentPteTemplate = TempPte;
4521 
4522  if (Subsection->NextSubsection != NULL) {
4523 
4524  //
4525  // Multiple segments and subsections.
4526  // Align first so it is a multiple of the allocation size.
4527  //
4528 
4529  NewSegment->NonExtendedPtes =
4530  (Subsection->PtesInSubsection & ~(((ULONG)AllocationFragment >> PAGE_SHIFT) - 1));
4531  }
4532  else {
4533  NewSegment->NonExtendedPtes = NewSegment->TotalNumberOfPtes;
4534  }
4535 
4536  Subsection->PtesInSubsection = NewSegment->NonExtendedPtes;
4537 
4538  FileOffset = 0;
4539 
4540  do {
4541 
4542  //
4543  // Loop through all the subsections to initialize them.
4544  //
4545 
4546  Subsection->ControlArea = ControlArea;
4547 
4548  Mi4KStartForSubsection(&FileOffset, Subsection);
4549 
4550  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.Protection = MM_EXECUTE_READWRITE;
4551 
4552  if (Subsection->NextSubsection == NULL) {
4553 
4554  LastFileChunk = (EndOfFile >> MM4K_SHIFT) - FileOffset;
4555 
4556  //
4557  // Note this next line restricts the number of bytes mapped by
4558  // a single subsection to 16TB-4K. Multiple subsections can always
4559  // be chained together to support an overall file of size 16K TB.
4560  //
4561 
4562  Subsection->NumberOfFullSectors = (ULONG)LastFileChunk;
4563 
4564  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.SectorEndOffset =
4565  (ULONG) EndOfFile & MM4K_MASK;
4566 
4567  j = Subsection->PtesInSubsection;
4568 
4569  Subsection->PtesInSubsection = (ULONG)(
4570  NumberOfPtesForEntireFile -
4571  (FileOffset >> (PAGE_SHIFT - MM4K_SHIFT)));
4572 
4573  MI_CHECK_SUBSECTION (Subsection);
4574 
4575  Subsection->UnusedPtes = j - Subsection->PtesInSubsection;
4576  }
4577  else {
4578  Subsection->NumberOfFullSectors =
4579  Subsection->PtesInSubsection << (PAGE_SHIFT - MM4K_SHIFT);
4580 
4581  MI_CHECK_SUBSECTION (Subsection);
4582  }
4583 
4584  FileOffset += (((UINT64)Subsection->PtesInSubsection) <<
4585  (PAGE_SHIFT - MM4K_SHIFT));
4586  Subsection = (PMSUBSECTION) Subsection->NextSubsection;
4587  } while (Subsection != NULL);
4588 
4589  return STATUS_SUCCESS;
4590 }
4591 
4592 VOID
4593 MiUpdateLargeProtoPfns (
4594  IN PMMPTE PointerPte,
4595  IN PMMPTE LastPte,
4596  IN PMMPFN Pfn1,
4597  IN MMPTE OriginalPte
4598  )
4599 {
4600  PMMPFN Pfn2;
4601  KIRQL OldIrql;
4602  PMMPTE PteFramePointer;
4603  PFN_NUMBER PdeFrame;
4604 
4605  PteFramePointer = MiGetPteAddress (PointerPte);
4606 #if (_MI_PAGING_LEVELS < 3)
4607  if (PteFramePointer->u.Hard.Valid == 0) {
4608  MiCheckPdeForPagedPool (PointerPte);
4609  }
4610 #endif
4611  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
4612 
4613  if (PteFramePointer->u.Hard.Valid == 0) {
4614  MiMakeSystemAddressValidPfn (PointerPte, OldIrql);
4615  }
4616 
4617  ASSERT (PteFramePointer->u.Hard.Valid == 1);
4618  PdeFrame = MI_GET_PAGE_FRAME_FROM_PTE (PteFramePointer);
4619  Pfn2 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PdeFrame);
4620 
4621  while (PointerPte < LastPte) {
4622 
4623  ASSERT (Pfn1->u2.ShareCount == 1);
4624  ASSERT (Pfn1->u3.e2.ReferenceCount == 1);
4625  ASSERT (Pfn1->u4.AweAllocation == 1);
4626 
4627  Pfn1->u3.e1.PrototypePte = 1;
4628  Pfn1->PteAddress = PointerPte;
4629  Pfn1->u4.PteFrame = PdeFrame;
4630  Pfn1->OriginalPte = OriginalPte;
4631 
4632  //
4633  // Also update the share count on the page containing the
4634  // prototype PTEs. This prevents the page from getting trimmed
4635  // which is good because we wouldn't know to update the PteFrame
4636  // of our physical pages then anyway !
4637  //
4638 
4639  Pfn2->u2.ShareCount += 1;
4640 
4641  PointerPte += 1;
4642  if (MiIsPteOnPdeBoundary (PointerPte)) {
4643 
4644  if (PointerPte == LastPte) {
4645  break;
4646  }
4647 
4648  PteFramePointer = MiGetPteAddress (PointerPte);
4649 #if (_MI_PAGING_LEVELS < 3)
4650  if (PteFramePointer->u.Hard.Valid == 0) {
4651  MiCheckPdeForPagedPool (PointerPte);
4652  }
4653 #endif
4654  if (PteFramePointer->u.Hard.Valid == 0) {
4655  MiMakeSystemAddressValidPfn (PointerPte, OldIrql);
4656  }
4657 
4658  ASSERT (PteFramePointer->u.Hard.Valid == 1);
4659 
4660  PdeFrame = MI_GET_PAGE_FRAME_FROM_PTE (PteFramePointer);
4661  Pfn2 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PdeFrame);
4662  }
4663  Pfn1 += 1;
4664  }
4665  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
4666 
4667  return;
4668 }
4669 
4670 NTSTATUS
4671 MiCreatePagingFileMap (
4672  OUT PSEGMENT *Segment,
4673  IN PUINT64 MaximumSize,
4674  IN MM_PROTECTION_MASK ProtectionMask,
4675  IN ULONG AllocationAttributes
4676  )
4677 
4678 /*++
4679 
4680 Routine Description:
4681 
4682  This function creates the necessary structures to allow the mapping
4683  of a paging file.
4684 
4685 Arguments:
4686 
4687  Segment - Returns the segment object.
4688 
4689  MaximumSize - Supplies the maximum size for the mapping.
4690 
4691  ProtectionMask - Supplies the initial page protection.
4692 
4693  AllocationAttributes - Supplies the allocation attributes for the mapping.
4694 
4695 Return Value:
4696 
4697  NTSTATUS.
4698 
4699 --*/
4700 
4701 {
4702  PMMPFN Pfn1;
4703  UINT64 MaximumFileSize;
4704  PFN_NUMBER NumberOfPtes;
4705  PFN_NUMBER PageFrameIndex;
4706  SIZE_T SizeOfSegment;
4707  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
4708  PSEGMENT NewSegment;
4709  PMMPTE PointerPte;
4710  PMMPTE LastPte;
4711  PSUBSECTION Subsection;
4712  MMPTE TempPte;
4713  MMPTE TempValidPte;
4714  PMI_LARGEPAGE_MEMORY_RUN LargePageInfo;
4715  PMI_LARGEPAGE_MEMORY_RUN LargePageListHead;
4716 
4717  PAGED_CODE();
4718 
4719  //*******************************************************************
4720  // Create a section backed by the paging file.
4721  //*******************************************************************
4722 
4723  if (*MaximumSize == 0) {
4724  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_4;
4725  }
4726 
4727  //
4728  // Limit page file backed sections to the amount of pool that could
4729  // possibly be allocated to hold the prototype PTEs. Note this may
4730  // be larger than the size of any *single* pagefile.
4731  //
4732 
4733 #if defined (_WIN64)
4734 
4735  //
4736  // Limit the maximum size to the number of PTEs that can be stored in
4737  // the NonExtendedPtes field in the segment so that segment deletion
4738  // which uses this will use the proper value.
4739  //
4740 
4741  MaximumFileSize = ((UINT64)1 << (32 + PAGE_SHIFT)) - sizeof (ULONG_PTR) - sizeof(SEGMENT);
4742 #else
4743  MaximumFileSize = MAXULONG_PTR - sizeof(SEGMENT);
4744 #endif
4745 
4746  MaximumFileSize /= sizeof(MMPTE);
4747  MaximumFileSize <<= PAGE_SHIFT;
4748 
4749  if (*MaximumSize > MaximumFileSize) {
4750  return STATUS_SECTION_TOO_BIG;
4751  }
4752 
4753  //
4754  // Create the segment object.
4755  //
4756  // Calculate the number of prototype PTEs to build for this segment.
4757  //
4758 
4759  LargePageListHead = NULL;
4760  NumberOfPtes = (PFN_NUMBER) ((*MaximumSize + PAGE_SIZE - 1) >> PAGE_SHIFT);
4761 
4762  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) {
4763 
4764  //
4765  // Commit the pages for the section.
4766  //
4767 
4768  ASSERT (ProtectionMask != 0);
4769 
4770  if (MiChargeCommitment (NumberOfPtes, NULL) == FALSE) {
4771  return STATUS_COMMITMENT_LIMIT;
4772  }
4773 
4774  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_LARGE_PAGES) {
4775 
4776 #ifdef _X86_
4777  if ((KeFeatureBits & KF_LARGE_PAGE) == 0) {
4778  return STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED;
4779  }
4780 #endif
4781  //
4782  // Ensure the requested size is a large page multiple.
4783  //
4784 
4785  if (NumberOfPtes % (MM_MINIMUM_VA_FOR_LARGE_PAGE >> PAGE_SHIFT)) {
4786  MiReturnCommitment (NumberOfPtes);
4787  return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER_4;
4788  }
4789 
4790  LargePageListHead = MiAllocateLargeZeroPages (NumberOfPtes,
4791  ProtectionMask);
4792 
4793  if (LargePageListHead == NULL) {
4794  MiReturnCommitment (NumberOfPtes);
4795  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
4796  }
4797  }
4798  }
4799 
4800  SizeOfSegment = sizeof(SEGMENT) + sizeof(MMPTE) * (NumberOfPtes - 1);
4801 
4802  NewSegment = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (PagedPool | POOL_MM_ALLOCATION,
4803  SizeOfSegment,
4804  MMSECT);
4805 
4806  if (NewSegment == NULL) {
4807 
4808  //
4809  // The requested pool could not be allocated.
4810  //
4811 
4812  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) {
4813  if (LargePageListHead != NULL) {
4814  MiReturnLargePages (LargePageListHead);
4815  }
4816  MiReturnCommitment (NumberOfPtes);
4817  }
4818  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
4819  }
4820 
4821  *Segment = NewSegment;
4822 
4823  ControlArea = ExAllocatePoolWithTag (NonPagedPool,
4824  sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) + sizeof(SUBSECTION),
4825  MMCONTROL);
4826 
4827  if (ControlArea == NULL) {
4828 
4829  //
4830  // The requested pool could not be allocated.
4831  //
4832 
4833  ExFreePool (NewSegment);
4834 
4835  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) {
4836  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_LARGE_PAGES) {
4837  if (LargePageListHead != NULL) {
4838  MiReturnLargePages (LargePageListHead);
4839  }
4840  }
4841  MiReturnCommitment (NumberOfPtes);
4842  }
4843  return STATUS_INSUFFICIENT_RESOURCES;
4844  }
4845 
4846  //
4847  // Zero control area and first subsection.
4848  //
4849 
4850  RtlZeroMemory (ControlArea, sizeof(CONTROL_AREA) + sizeof(SUBSECTION));
4851 
4852  ControlArea->Segment = NewSegment;
4853  ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences = 1;
4854  ControlArea->NumberOfUserReferences = 1;
4855 
4856  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_BASED) {
4857  ControlArea->u.Flags.Based = 1;
4858  }
4859 
4860  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_RESERVE) {
4861  ControlArea->u.Flags.Reserve = 1;
4862  }
4863 
4864  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) {
4865  ControlArea->u.Flags.Commit = 1;
4866  }
4867 
4868  Subsection = (PSUBSECTION)(ControlArea + 1);
4869 
4870  Subsection->ControlArea = ControlArea;
4871  Subsection->PtesInSubsection = (ULONG)NumberOfPtes;
4872  Subsection->u.SubsectionFlags.Protection = ProtectionMask;
4873 
4874  //
4875  // Align the prototype PTEs on the proper boundary.
4876  //
4877 
4878  PointerPte = &NewSegment->ThePtes[0];
4879 
4880  //
4881  // Zero the segment header.
4882  //
4883 
4884  RtlZeroMemory (NewSegment, sizeof(SEGMENT));
4885 
4886  NewSegment->PrototypePte = PointerPte;
4887 
4888  NewSegment->ControlArea = ControlArea;
4889 
4890  //
4891  // Record the process that created this segment for the performance
4892  // analysis tools.
4893  //
4894 
4895  NewSegment->u1.CreatingProcess = PsGetCurrentProcess ();
4896 
4897  NewSegment->SizeOfSegment = (UINT64)NumberOfPtes * PAGE_SIZE;
4898  NewSegment->TotalNumberOfPtes = (ULONG)NumberOfPtes;
4899  NewSegment->NonExtendedPtes = (ULONG)NumberOfPtes;
4900 
4901  Subsection->SubsectionBase = PointerPte;
4902  TempPte.u.Long = 0;
4903 
4904  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_COMMIT) {
4905  TempPte.u.Soft.Protection = ProtectionMask;
4906 
4907  //
4908  // Record commitment charging.
4909  //
4910 
4911  MM_TRACK_COMMIT (MM_DBG_COMMIT_PAGEFILE_BACKED_SHMEM, NumberOfPtes);
4912 
4913  NewSegment->NumberOfCommittedPages = NumberOfPtes;
4914 
4915  InterlockedExchangeAddSizeT (&MmSharedCommit, NumberOfPtes);
4916 
4917  if (AllocationAttributes & SEC_LARGE_PAGES) {
4918 
4919  NewSegment->SegmentFlags.LargePages = 1;
4920 
4921  //
4922  // Fill all the prototype PTEs with valid entries. Note this is
4923  // unusual for prototype PTEs because these entries are valid
4924  // with a nonzero share and and reference count even though no
4925  // real page table entries are currently mapping them. This is
4926  // to prevent premature trimming of them.
4927  //
4928 
4929  MI_MAKE_VALID_PTE (TempValidPte,
4930  0,
4931  ProtectionMask,
4932  NULL);
4933 
4934  if (ProtectionMask & MM_PROTECTION_WRITE_MASK) {
4935  MI_SET_PTE_DIRTY (TempValidPte);
4936  }
4937 
4938  while (LargePageListHead != NULL) {
4939 
4940  LargePageInfo = LargePageListHead;
4941  LargePageListHead = LargePageListHead->Next;
4942 
4943  PageFrameIndex = LargePageInfo->BasePage;
4944  Pfn1 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PageFrameIndex);
4945  ASSERT (LargePageInfo->PageCount != 0);
4946  LastPte = PointerPte + LargePageInfo->PageCount;
4947 
4948  do {
4949  TempValidPte.u.Hard.PageFrameNumber = PageFrameIndex;
4950  PageFrameIndex += 1;
4951  Pfn1 += 1;
4952  *PointerPte = TempValidPte;
4953  PointerPte += 1;
4954  } while (PointerPte < LastPte);
4955 
4956  MiUpdateLargeProtoPfns (PointerPte - LargePageInfo->PageCount,
4957  LastPte,
4958  Pfn1 - LargePageInfo->PageCount,
4959  TempPte);
4960 
4961  ExFreePool (LargePageInfo);
4962  }
4963  }
4964  }
4965 
4966  NewSegment->SegmentPteTemplate.u.Soft.Protection = ProtectionMask;
4967 
4968  //
4969  // Set all the prototype PTEs to either no access or demand zero
4970  // depending on the commit flag.
4971  //
4972 
4973  if ((AllocationAttributes & SEC_LARGE_PAGES) == 0) {
4974  MiFillMemoryPte (PointerPte, NumberOfPtes, TempPte.u.Long);
4975  }
4976 
4977  return STATUS_SUCCESS;
4978 }

4980 
4981 NTSTATUS
4982 NtOpenSection(
4983  __out PHANDLE SectionHandle,
4984  __in ACCESS_MASK DesiredAccess,
4985  __in POBJECT_ATTRIBUTES ObjectAttributes
4986  )
4987 
4988 /*++
4989 
4990 Routine Description:
4991 
4992  This function opens a handle to a section object with the specified
4993  desired access.
4994 
4995 Arguments:
4996 
4997 
4998  Sectionhandle - Supplies a pointer to a variable that will
4999  receive the section object handle value.
5000 
5001  DesiredAccess - Supplies the desired types of access for the
5002  section.
5003 
5004  DesiredAccess Flags
5005 
5006  EXECUTE - Execute access to the section is desired.
5007 
5008  READ - Read access to the section is desired.
5009 
5010  WRITE - Write access to the section is desired.
5011 
5012  ObjectAttributes - Supplies a pointer to an object attributes structure.
5013 
5014 Return Value:
5015 
5016  NTSTATUS.
5017 
5018 --*/
5019 
5020 {
5021  HANDLE Handle;
5022  KPROCESSOR_MODE PreviousMode;
5023  NTSTATUS Status;
5024 
5025  PAGED_CODE();
5026  //
5027  // Get previous processor mode and probe output arguments if necessary.
5028  //
5029 
5030  PreviousMode = KeGetPreviousMode();
5031  if (PreviousMode != KernelMode) {
5032  try {
5033  ProbeForWriteHandle(SectionHandle);
5034  } except (EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER) {
5035  return GetExceptionCode();
5036  }
5037  }
5038 
5039  //
5040  // Open handle to the section object with the specified desired
5041  // access.
5042  //
5043 
5044  Status = ObOpenObjectByName (ObjectAttributes,
5045  MmSectionObjectType,
5046  PreviousMode,
5047  NULL,
5048  DesiredAccess,
5049  NULL,
5050  &Handle);
5051 
5052  try {
5053  *SectionHandle = Handle;
5054  } except (EXCEPTION_EXECUTE_HANDLER) {
5055  return Status;
5056  }
5057 
5058  return Status;
5059 }
5060 
5061 CCHAR
5062 MiGetImageProtection (
5063  IN ULONG SectionCharacteristics
5064  )
5065 
5066 /*++
5067 
5068 Routine Description:
5069 
5070  This function takes a section characteristic mask from the
5071  image and converts it to an PTE protection mask.
5072 
5073 Arguments:
5074 
5075  SectionCharacteristics - Supplies the characteristics mask from the
5076  image.
5077 
5078 Return Value:
5079 
5080  Returns the protection mask for the PTE.
5081 
5082 --*/
5083 
5084 {
5085  ULONG Index;
5086 
5087  PAGED_CODE();
5088 
5089  Index = 0;
5090  if (SectionCharacteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_EXECUTE) {
5091  Index |= 1;
5092  }
5093  if (SectionCharacteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_READ) {
5094  Index |= 2;
5095  }
5096  if (SectionCharacteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_WRITE) {
5097  Index |= 4;
5098  }
5099  if (SectionCharacteristics & IMAGE_SCN_MEM_SHARED) {
5100  Index |= 8;
5101  }
5102 
5103  return MmImageProtectionArray[Index];
5104 }
5105 
5106 PFN_NUMBER
5107 MiGetPageForHeader (
5108  LOGICAL ZeroPage
5109  )
5110 
5111 /*++
5112 
5113 Routine Description:
5114 
5115  This non-pageable function acquires the PFN lock, removes
5116  a page and updates the PFN database as though the page was
5117  ready to be deleted if the reference count is decremented.
5118 
5119 Arguments:
5120 
5121  ZeroPage - Supplies TRUE if the caller requires a zero-filled page.
5122 
5123 Return Value:
5124 
5125  Returns the physical page frame number.
5126 
5127 --*/
5128 
5129 {
5130  KIRQL OldIrql;
5131  PFN_NUMBER PageFrameNumber;
5132  PMMPFN Pfn1;
5133  PEPROCESS Process;
5134  ULONG PageColor;
5135  LOGICAL TbFlushNeeded;
5136 
5137  TbFlushNeeded = FALSE;
5138  Process = PsGetCurrentProcess ();
5139 
5140  PageColor = MI_PAGE_COLOR_VA_PROCESS ((PVOID)X64K,
5141  &Process->NextPageColor);
5142 
5143  //
5144  // Lock the PFN database and get a page.
5145  //
5146 
5147  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5148 
5149  if (MmAvailablePages < MM_HIGH_LIMIT) {
5150  MiEnsureAvailablePageOrWait (NULL, OldIrql);
5151  }
5152 
5153  //
5154  // Remove page for 64k alignment.
5155  //
5156 
5157  if (ZeroPage) {
5158  PageFrameNumber = MiRemoveZeroPage (PageColor);
5159  }
5160  else {
5161  PageFrameNumber = MiRemoveAnyPage (PageColor);
5162  }
5163 
5164  //
5165  // Increment the reference count for the page so the
5166  // paging I/O will work, and so this page cannot be stolen from us.
5167  //
5168 
5169  Pfn1 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PageFrameNumber);
5170  Pfn1->u3.e2.ReferenceCount += 1;
5171 
5172  if (Pfn1->u3.e1.CacheAttribute != MiCached) {
5173  TbFlushNeeded = TRUE;
5174  Pfn1->u3.e1.CacheAttribute = MiCached;
5175  }
5176 
5177  //
5178  // Don't need the PFN lock for the fields below...
5179  //
5180 
5181  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5182 
5183  ASSERT (Pfn1->u1.Flink == 0);
5184  ASSERT (Pfn1->u2.Blink == 0);
5185 
5186  Pfn1->OriginalPte.u.Long = 0;
5187  Pfn1->PteAddress = (PVOID) (ULONG_PTR)X64K;
5188  MI_SET_PFN_DELETED (Pfn1);
5189 
5190  if (TbFlushNeeded == TRUE) {
5191  MI_FLUSH_TB_FOR_CACHED_ATTRIBUTE ();
5192  }
5193 
5194  return PageFrameNumber;
5195 }

5197 VOID
5198 MiUpdateImageHeaderPage (
5199  IN PMMPTE PointerPte,
5200  IN PFN_NUMBER PageFrameNumber,
5201  IN PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea,
5202  IN LOGICAL MarkModified
5203  )
5204 
5205 /*++
5206 
5207 Routine Description:
5208 
5209  This non-pageable function acquires the PFN lock, and
5210  turns the specified prototype PTE into a transition PTE
5211  referring to the specified physical page. It then
5212  decrements the reference count causing the page to
5213  be placed on the standby or modified list.
5214 
5215 Arguments:
5216 
5217  PointerPte - Supplies the PTE to set into the transition state.
5218 
5219  PageFrameNumber - Supplies the physical page.
5220 
5221  ControlArea - Supplies the control area for the prototype PTEs.
5222 
5223  MarkModified - Supplies TRUE if the PFN should be marked modified (this
5224  will give it pagefile-backing on trim vs filesystem backing).
5225 
5226 Return Value:
5227 
5228  None.
5229 
5230 --*/
5231 
5232 {
5233  PMMPTE PointerPde;
5234  PMMPFN Pfn1;
5235  KIRQL OldIrql;
5236 
5237  Pfn1 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PageFrameNumber);
5238 
5239  PointerPde = MiGetPteAddress (PointerPte);
5240  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5241 
5242  if (PointerPde->u.Hard.Valid == 0) {
5243  MiMakeSystemAddressValidPfn (PointerPte, OldIrql);
5244  }
5245 
5246  MiInitializeTransitionPfn (PageFrameNumber, PointerPte);
5247 
5248  if (MarkModified == TRUE) {
5249  MI_SET_MODIFIED (Pfn1, 1, 0x19);
5250  }
5251 
5252  if (Pfn1->OriginalPte.u.Soft.Prototype == 1) {
5253  ControlArea->NumberOfPfnReferences += 1;
5254  }
5255 
5256  //
5257  // Add the page to the standby list.
5258  //
5259 
5260  MiDecrementReferenceCount (Pfn1, PageFrameNumber);
5261 
5262  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5263  return;
5264 }
