5299 
5300 PCONTROL_AREA
5301 MiFindImageSectionObject (
5302  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
5303  IN LOGICAL PfnLockHeld,
5304  OUT PLOGICAL GlobalNeeded
5305  )
5306 
5307 /*++
5308 
5309 Routine Description:
5310 
5311  This function searches the control area chains (if any) for an existing
5312  cache of the specified image file. For non-global control areas, there is
5313  no chain and the control area is shared for all callers and sessions.
5314  Likewise for systemwide global control areas.
5315 
5316  However, for global PER-SESSION control areas, we must do the walk.
5317 
5318 Arguments:
5319 
5320  File - Supplies the file object for the image file.
5321 
5322  PfnLockHeld - Indicates whether the PFN database is locked upon entering this routine.
5323 
5324  GlobalNeeded - Supplies a pointer to store whether a global control area is
5325  required as a placeholder. This can only be set when there
5326  is already some global control area in the list - ie: our
5327  caller should only rely on this when this function returns
5328  NULL so the caller knows what kind of control area to
5329  insert.
5330 
5331 Return Value:
5332 
5333  Returns the matching control area or NULL if one does not exist.
5334 
5335 Environment:
5336 
5337  Must be holding the PFN lock.
5338 
5339 --*/
5340 
5341 {
5342  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
5343  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA LargeControlArea;
5344  PLIST_ENTRY Head, Next;
5345  ULONG SessionId;
5346  KIRQL OldIrql;
5347 
5348  *GlobalNeeded = FALSE;
5349 
5350  if (PfnLockHeld == FALSE) {
5351  LOCK_PFN(OldIrql);
5352  } else {
5353  SATISFY_OVERZEALOUS_COMPILER(OldIrql = PASSIVE_LEVEL);
5354  MM_PFN_LOCK_ASSERT();
5355  }
5356 
5357  //
5358  // Get first (if any) control area pointer.
5359  //
5360 
5361  ControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA)(File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject);
5362 
5363  //
5364  // If no control area, or the control area is not session global,
5365  // then our job is easy. Note, however, that they each require different
5366  // return values as they represent different states.
5367  //
5368 
5369  if ((ControlArea == NULL) || (ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0)) {
5370  goto ControlAreaFound;
5371  }
5372 
5373  LargeControlArea = (PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA) ControlArea;
5374 
5375  //
5376  // Get the current session ID and search for a matching control area.
5377  //
5378 
5379  SessionId = MmGetSessionId (PsGetCurrentProcess());
5380 
5381  if (LargeControlArea->SessionId == SessionId) {
5382  // ControlArea and LargeControlArea are the same.
5383  goto ControlAreaFound;
5384  }
5385 
5386  //
5387  // Must search the control area list for a matching session ID.
5388  //
5389 
5390  Head = &LargeControlArea->UserGlobalList;
5391 
5392  for (Next = Head->Flink; Next != Head; Next = Next->Flink) {
5393 
5394  LargeControlArea = CONTAINING_RECORD (Next, LARGE_CONTROL_AREA, UserGlobalList);
5395 
5396  ASSERT (LargeControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 1);
5397 
5398  if (LargeControlArea->SessionId == SessionId) {
5399  ControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA) LargeControlArea;
5400  goto ControlAreaFound;
5401  }
5402  }
5403  //
5404  // No match, so tell our caller to create a new global control area.
5405  //
5406  ControlArea = NULL;
5407  *GlobalNeeded = TRUE;
5408 
5409 ControlAreaFound:
5410  if (PfnLockHeld == FALSE) {
5411  UNLOCK_PFN(OldIrql);
5412  }
5413 
5414  return ControlArea;
5415 }
5416 
5417 VOID
5418 MiInsertImageSectionObject(
5419  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
5420  IN PCONTROL_AREA InputControlArea
5421  )
5422 
5423 /*++
5424 
5425 Routine Description:
5426 
5427  This function inserts the control area into the file's section object
5428  pointers. For non-global control areas, there is no chain and the
5429  control area is shared for all callers and sessions.
5430  Likewise for systemwide global control areas.
5431 
5432  However, for global PER-SESSION control areas, we must do a list insertion.
5433 
5434 Arguments:
5435 
5436  File - Supplies the file object for the image file.
5437 
5438  InputControlArea - Supplies the control area to insert.
5439 
5440 Return Value:
5441 
5442  None.
5443 
5444 Environment:
5445 
5446  Must be holding the PFN lock.
5447 
5448 --*/
5449 
5450 {
5451  PLIST_ENTRY Head;
5452  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
5453  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA FirstControlArea;
5454 #if DBG
5455  PLIST_ENTRY Next;
5456  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA NextControlArea;
5457 #endif
5458 
5459  MM_PFN_LOCK_ASSERT();
5460 
5461  ControlArea = (PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA) InputControlArea;
5462 
5463  //
5464  // If this is not a global-per-session control area or just a placeholder
5465  // control area (with no chain already in place) then just put it in.
5466  //
5467 
5468  FirstControlArea = (PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA)(File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject);
5469 
5470  if (FirstControlArea == NULL) {
5471  if (ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0) {
5472  File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject = (PVOID)ControlArea;
5473  return;
5474  }
5475  }
5476 
5477  //
5478  // A per-session control area needs to be inserted...
5479  //
5480 
5481  ASSERT (ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 1);
5482 
5483  ControlArea->SessionId = MmGetSessionId (PsGetCurrentProcess());
5484 
5485  //
5486  // If the control area list is empty, just initialize links for this entry.
5487  //
5488 
5489  if (File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject == NULL) {
5490  InitializeListHead (&ControlArea->UserGlobalList);
5491  }
5492  else {
5493 
5494  //
5495  // Insert new entry before the current first entry. The control area
5496  // must be in the midst of creation/deletion or have a valid session
5497  // ID to be inserted.
5498  //
5499 
5500  ASSERT (ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingDeleted ||
5501  ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated ||
5502  ControlArea->SessionId != (ULONG)-1);
5503 
5504  FirstControlArea = (PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA)(File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject);
5505 
5506  Head = &FirstControlArea->UserGlobalList;
5507 
5508 #if DBG
5509  //
5510  // Ensure no duplicate session IDs exist in the list.
5511  //
5512 
5513  for (Next = Head->Flink; Next != Head; Next = Next->Flink) {
5514  NextControlArea = CONTAINING_RECORD (Next, LARGE_CONTROL_AREA, UserGlobalList);
5515  ASSERT (NextControlArea->SessionId != (ULONG)-1 &&
5516  NextControlArea->SessionId != ControlArea->SessionId);
5517  }
5518 #endif
5519 
5520  InsertTailList (Head, &ControlArea->UserGlobalList);
5521  }
5522 
5523  //
5524  // Update first control area pointer.
5525  //
5526 
5527  File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject = (PVOID) ControlArea;
5528 }
5529 
5530 VOID
5531 MiRemoveImageSectionObject(
5532  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
5533  IN PCONTROL_AREA InputControlArea
5534  )
5535 
5536 /*++
5537 
5538 Routine Description:
5539 
5540  This function searches the control area chains (if any) for an existing
5541  cache of the specified image file. For non-global control areas, there is
5542  no chain and the control area is shared for all callers and sessions.
5543  Likewise for systemwide global control areas.
5544 
5545  However, for global PER-SESSION control areas, we must do the walk.
5546 
5547  Upon finding the specified control area, we unlink it.
5548 
5549 Arguments:
5550 
5551  File - Supplies the file object for the image file.
5552 
5553  InputControlArea - Supplies the control area to remove.
5554 
5555 Return Value:
5556 
5557  None.
5558 
5559 Environment:
5560 
5561  Must be holding the PFN lock.
5562 
5563 --*/
5564 
5565 {
5566 #if DBG
5567  PLIST_ENTRY Head;
5568 #endif
5569  PLIST_ENTRY Next;
5570  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
5571  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA FirstControlArea;
5572  PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA NextControlArea;
5573 
5574  MM_PFN_LOCK_ASSERT();
5575 
5576  ControlArea = (PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA) InputControlArea;
5577 
5578  FirstControlArea = (PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA)(File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject);
5579 
5580  //
5581  // Get a pointer to the first control area. If this is not a
5582  // global-per-session control area, then there is no list, so we're done.
5583  //
5584 
5585  if (FirstControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0) {
5586  ASSERT (ControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 0);
5587 
5588  File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject = NULL;
5589  return;
5590  }
5591 
5592  //
5593  // A list may exist. Walk it as necessary and delete the requested entry.
5594  //
5595 
5596  if (FirstControlArea == ControlArea) {
5597 
5598  //
5599  // The first entry is the one to remove. If it is the only entry
5600  // in the list, then the new first entry pointer will be NULL.
5601  // Otherwise, get a pointer to the next entry and unlink the current.
5602  //
5603 
5604  if (IsListEmpty (&FirstControlArea->UserGlobalList)) {
5605  NextControlArea = NULL;
5606  }
5607  else {
5608  Next = FirstControlArea->UserGlobalList.Flink;
5609  RemoveEntryList (&FirstControlArea->UserGlobalList);
5610  NextControlArea = CONTAINING_RECORD (Next,
5611  LARGE_CONTROL_AREA,
5612  UserGlobalList);
5613 
5614  ASSERT (NextControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 1);
5615  }
5616 
5617  File->SectionObjectPointer->ImageSectionObject = (PVOID)NextControlArea;
5618  return;
5619  }
5620 
5621  //
5622  // Remove the entry, note that the ImageSectionObject need not be updated
5623  // as the entry is not at the head.
5624  //
5625 
5626 #if DBG
5627  Head = &FirstControlArea->UserGlobalList;
5628 
5629  for (Next = Head->Flink; Next != Head; Next = Next->Flink) {
5630 
5631  NextControlArea = CONTAINING_RECORD (Next,
5632  LARGE_CONTROL_AREA,
5633  UserGlobalList);
5634 
5635  ASSERT (NextControlArea->u.Flags.GlobalOnlyPerSession == 1);
5636 
5637  if (NextControlArea == ControlArea) {
5638  break;
5639  }
5640  }
5641  ASSERT (Next != Head);
5642 #endif
5643 
5644  RemoveEntryList (&ControlArea->UserGlobalList);
5645 }

5647 LOGICAL
5648 MiFlushDataSection (
5649  IN PFILE_OBJECT File
5650  )
5651 
5652 /*++
5653 
5654 Routine Description:
5655 
5656  This routine flushes the data section if there is one.
5657 
5658 Arguments:
5659 
5660  File - Supplies the file object.
5661 
5662 Return Value:
5663 
5664  TRUE if there is a data section that may be in use, FALSE if not.
5665 
5666 Environment:
5667 
5668  Kernel mode, APC_LEVEL and below.
5669 
5670 --*/
5671 
5672 {
5673  KIRQL OldIrql;
5674  IO_STATUS_BLOCK IoStatus;
5675  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
5676  LOGICAL DataInUse;
5677 
5678  DataInUse = FALSE;
5679 
5680  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5681 
5682  ControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA) File->SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject;
5683 
5684  if (ControlArea) {
5685 
5686  if ((ControlArea->NumberOfSectionReferences != 0) ||
5687  (ControlArea->NumberOfMappedViews != 0)) {
5688 
5689  DataInUse = TRUE;
5690  }
5691

5695  NULL,
5696  0,
5697  &IoStatus);
5698 
5699  }
5700  else {
5701  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5702  MmFlushSection (File->SectionObjectPointer,
5703  NULL,
5704  0,
5705  &IoStatus,
5706  TRUE);
5707  }
5708  }
5709  else {
5710  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5711  }
5712 
5713  return DataInUse;
5714 }

5716 
5717 PVOID
5718 MiCopyHeaderIfResident (
5719  IN PFILE_OBJECT File,
5720  IN PFN_NUMBER ImagePageFrameNumber
5721  )
5722 
5723 /*++
5724 
5725 Routine Description:
5726 
5727  This routine copies the image header from the data section if there is
5728  one and the page is already resident or in transition.
5729 
5730 Arguments:
5731 
5732  File - Supplies the file object.
5733 
5734  ImagePageFrameNumber - Supplies the image frame to copy the data into.
5735 
5736 Return Value:
5737 
5738  Virtual address of the image page frame number if successful, NULL if not.
5739 
5740 Environment:
5741 
5742  Kernel mode, APC_LEVEL and below.
5743 
5744 --*/
5745 
5746 {
5747  PMMPFN Pfn1;
5748  PVOID DataPage;
5749  PVOID ImagePage;
5750  KIRQL OldIrql;
5751  PCONTROL_AREA ControlArea;
5752  PMMPTE ImagePte;
5753  PMMPTE PointerPte;
5754  MMPTE PteContents;
5755  PFN_NUMBER PageFrameIndex;
5756  PEPROCESS Process;
5757  PSUBSECTION Subsection;
5758  PSECTION_OBJECT_POINTERS SectionObjectPointer;
5759 
5760  //
5761  // Take a quick (safely unsynchronized) look to see whether to bother
5762  // mapping the image header page at all - if there's no data section
5763  // object, then skip it and just return.
5764  //
5765 
5766  SectionObjectPointer = File->SectionObjectPointer;
5767  if (SectionObjectPointer == NULL) {
5768  return NULL;
5769  }
5770 
5771  ControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA) SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject;
5772 
5773  if (ControlArea == NULL) {
5774  return NULL;
5775  }
5776 
5777  //
5778  // There's a data section, so map the target page.
5779  //
5780 
5781  ImagePte = MiReserveSystemPtes (1, SystemPteSpace);
5782 
5783  if (ImagePte == NULL) {
5784  return NULL;
5785  }
5786 
5787  ImagePage = MiGetVirtualAddressMappedByPte (ImagePte);
5788 
5789  ASSERT (ImagePte->u.Hard.Valid == 0);
5790 
5791  PteContents = ValidKernelPte;
5792  PteContents.u.Hard.PageFrameNumber = ImagePageFrameNumber;
5793 
5794  MI_WRITE_VALID_PTE (ImagePte, PteContents);
5795 
5796  LOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5797 
5798  //
5799  // Now that we are synchronized via the PFN lock, take a safe look.
5800  //
5801 
5802  SectionObjectPointer = File->SectionObjectPointer;
5803  if (SectionObjectPointer == NULL) {
5804  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5805  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5806  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5807  }
5808  return NULL;
5809  }
5810 
5811  ControlArea = (PCONTROL_AREA) SectionObjectPointer->DataSectionObject;
5812 
5813  if (ControlArea == NULL) {
5814  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5815  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5816  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5817  }
5818  return NULL;
5819  }
5820 
5821  if ((ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingCreated) ||
5822  (ControlArea->u.Flags.BeingDeleted)) {
5823 
5824  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5825  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5826  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5827  }
5828  return NULL;
5829  }
5830 
5831  if (ControlArea->u.Flags.Rom == 0) {
5832  Subsection = (PSUBSECTION) (ControlArea + 1);
5833  }
5834  else {
5835  Subsection = (PSUBSECTION)((PLARGE_CONTROL_AREA)ControlArea + 1);
5836  }
5837 
5838  //
5839  // If the prototype PTEs have been tossed (or never created) then we
5840  // don't have any data to copy.
5841  //
5842 
5843  PointerPte = Subsection->SubsectionBase;
5844 
5845  if (PointerPte == NULL) {
5846  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5847  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5848  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5849  }
5850  return NULL;
5851  }
5852 
5853  if (MiGetPteAddress (PointerPte)->u.Hard.Valid == 0) {
5854 
5855  //
5856  // We have no reference to the data section so if we can't do this
5857  // without relinquishing the PFN lock, then don't bother.
5858  // ie: the entire control area and everything can be freed
5859  // while a call to MiMakeSystemAddressValidPfn releases the lock.
5860  //
5861 
5862  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5863  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5864  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5865  }
5866  return NULL;
5867  }
5868 
5869  PteContents = *PointerPte;
5870 
5871  if ((PteContents.u.Hard.Valid == 1) ||
5872  ((PteContents.u.Soft.Prototype == 0) &&
5873  (PteContents.u.Soft.Transition == 1))) {
5874 
5875  if (PteContents.u.Hard.Valid == 1) {
5876  PageFrameIndex = MI_GET_PAGE_FRAME_FROM_PTE (&PteContents);
5877  }
5878  else {
5879  PageFrameIndex = MI_GET_PAGE_FRAME_FROM_TRANSITION_PTE (&PteContents);
5880  Pfn1 = MI_PFN_ELEMENT (PageFrameIndex);
5881 
5882  if (Pfn1->u3.e1.ReadInProgress != 0) {
5883  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5884  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5885  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5886  }
5887  return NULL;
5888  }
5889  }
5890 
5891  Process = PsGetCurrentProcess ();
5892 
5893  DataPage = MiMapPageInHyperSpaceAtDpc (Process, PageFrameIndex);
5894 
5895  RtlCopyMemory (ImagePage, DataPage, PAGE_SIZE);
5896 
5897  MiUnmapPageInHyperSpaceFromDpc (Process, DataPage);
5898 
5899  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5900 
5901  //
5902  // If the new page had been used to hold code in a previous
5903  // life we must ensure the instruction cache is kept coherent.
5904  // The data copy above is not sufficient on platforms where
5905  // the I-cache & D-cache are not kept coherent in hardware
5906  // so sweep it here for them.
5907  //
5908 
5909  KeSweepIcacheRange (TRUE, ImagePage, PAGE_SIZE);
5910 
5911  return ImagePage;
5912  }
5913 
5914  //
5915  // The data page is not resident, so return NULL and the caller will take
5916  // the long way.
5917  //
5918 
5919  UNLOCK_PFN (OldIrql);
5920 
5921  if (ImagePte != NULL) {
5922  MiReleaseSystemPtes (ImagePte, 1, SystemPteSpace);
5923  }
5924 
5925  return NULL;
5926 }
